Software Engineer ModelOps

RStudio is seeking a candidate for a Software Engineer to join the Open Source group to work on Python model ops software.

The Open Source group develops and maintains open source packages for data science, including R packages like ggplot2, dplyr, tidymodels, shiny, sparklyr, and RMarkdown. Since many data science teams involve both R and Python users, we are exploring how we can best contribute to the Python ecosystem. The goals of the Open Source group are not only to provide a seamless end-to-end data science experience, but also to help users learn and flourish. This involves developing and disseminating documentation (at the function, package, and task level) and fostering a welcoming community. We value kindness, humility, openness, and resourcefulness in our work and interactions with the community and each other.

For this role, we are looking for an experienced developer who will create and maintain Python packages for model deployment, monitoring, retraining, and more. You will work broadly with the tidymodels team and collaborate with other teams at RStudio involved in model deployment and Python package development. We are looking for candidates interested in creating harmonious model ops solutions for bilingual (R/Python) data science teams, as well as establishing Python development efforts within our group in general.

What you may work on:

In this role you’ll develop and maintain Python packages for model ops. You will write tests and code, drive technical decisions, develop documentation, and engage with the community. Areas of work will include:

Thinking strategically about the Python ecosystem and how we can best serve the Python data science community with our open source tools.
Working with coworkers across RStudio teams to break down new feature development into a concrete plan, write code and tests, respond to code reviews, and communicate the features to the wider community.
Triaging issues, helping clearly identify user needs for new features, and closing issues that we don’t have the resources to fix.
Reproducing and diagnosing reported bugs, converting them to unit tests, and developing code to fix them.
Maintaining and developing documentation.
Creating a welcoming environment for open source contributors.

About you:

You share our commitment to building open source software that provides a seamless end-to-end data science experience and an ecosystem that helps users learn and flourish. You are an applied modeling practitioner eager to translate what you’ve learned building machine learning systems to creating and maintaining widely-used open source model ops tooling. You think holistically about the end-to-end model lifecycle, and you love to help others succeed. You are humble, pragmatic, deliberate, and you have a keen sense of empathy for your community and co-workers. You also are:

Professional Python developer with experience developing models and creating robust ML systems.
Nice to have: Have created and published one or more Python libraries, e.g. on PyPI.
R-curious. Should be interested in R and willing to learn what makes it special.
Nice to have: Existing experience with modeling or programming in R.
Collaborative. Should be able to collaborate with multiple teams to make sure all the pieces fit together, contributing to and listening to diverse perspectives.
Effective communicator. Should be able to work effectively in a remote setting, as well as engage in written communication with users and contributors on GitHub.
Attentive to detail. Should be able to maintain and develop accurate, helpful, and inclusive written materials.
Action oriented. Should be able to follow up on feedback and make decisions even where there is uncertainty.
Invested in learning. Should be interested in and able to learn new things both technical and community-oriented.
Stewardship. Should work to leave things better than you found them.
About us
RStudio is a Public Benefit Corporation (PBC) and a Certified B Corporation®, which means that our open-source mission is codified into our charter, and that our corporate decisions balance the interests of the community, customers, employees, and shareholders.
We welcome all talented colleagues and are committed to a culture that represents diversity in all its forms.
We prioritize giving ourselves “focus time” to get deep work done. We minimize meetings and attempt to operate asynchronously.
We are a learning organization and take mentorship and career growth seriously. We hope to learn from you, and we anticipate that you will also deepen your skills, influence, and leadership as a result of working at RStudio.
We operate under a unique, sustainable business model: We have over 50% of our engineering dedicated to creating free and open source software. We are profitable, and we plan to be around decades from now.

Notable

100% distributed team (or come into one of our offices in Seattle or Boston) with minimal travel
Competitive compensation with great benefits including:
medical/dental/vision insurance (100% of premiums covered)
401k matching
a home office allowance or reimbursement for a coworking space
a profit-sharing system
Flexible environment with a generous vacation policy

RStudio is committed to being a diverse and inclusive workplace. We encourage applicants of different backgrounds, cultures, genders, experiences, abilities, and perspectives to apply. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, age, physical disability, or length of time spent unemployed.

JobTitle: Senior Engineering Manager, Health and Safety, Google Resear...
Content_text:
Note: By applying to this position you will have an opportunity to share your preferred working location from the following: Seattle, WA, USA; Mountain View, CA, USA.
Minimum qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree, or equivalent practical experience.
5 years of experience with software development in one or more programming languages (e.g., Python, C, C++, Java, JavaScript).
5 years of experience in a technical leadership role; overseeing strategic projects, with 5 years of experience in a people management, supervision/team leadership role.

Preferred qualifications:

Master's degree or PhD in Computer Science or related technical field.
5 years of experience with machine learning algorithms and tools (e.g., TensorFlow), or applied ML (e.g., deep learning, natural language processing).
5 years of experience working in a complex, matrixed organization.
About the job
Our team's mission is to improve health and well-being with on-device intelligence, while safeguarding privacy.
As a Senior Engineering Manager, you will focus on public health and safety within Google Research. Through partnerships with Google Product teams, you will bring together cutting-edge machine learning (ML) approaches with a focus on saving and improving lives among our users and the world’s population as a whole. In this role, you will focus on internal and external partnerships, recruit and hire a new sub-team to build out one of these partnerships, and contribute to team-wide strategy.

Google Research is building the next generation of intelligent systems for all Google products. To achieve this, we’re working on projects that utilize the latest computer science techniques developed by skilled software engineers and research scientists. Google Research teams collaborate closely with other teams across Google, maintaining the flexibility and versatility required to adapt new projects and foci that meet the demands of the world's fast-paced business needs.
Responsibilities
Find, develop, and maintain partnerships with internal teams across Google, as well as external Non-Governmental Organizations, municipalities, and government agencies.
Vet and expand out new project opportunities from partners.
Develop strategy and architecture.
Work closely with Engineering director to invent, build, and lead new efforts on the team.
Recruit, hire, and manage a team of ML-focused Software Engineers who will support projects.
Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form.

The Opportunity

As a Data Scientist, you’ll use optimization, integer and dynamic programming, simulation, and machine learning techniques to better understand the interactions within our Fulfillment Centers, and use that information to increase efficiency and reduce order cycle times. You’ll work with key stakeholders to crisply define business questions, success criteria, and deployment plans. You’ll use reproducible research techniques to create analytical data sets, conduct exploratory data analysis, select, and engineer features, train, tune, and evaluate candidate models, and distill and present findings.

You will help optimize Fulfillment Center layouts and processes by using simulation methodologies, such as deterministic simulation, stochastic simulation, and Monte Carlo simulation, to capture the entire process from SKU inbound to and outbound from the Fulfillment Centers. You will provide test results in different Fulfillment Center re-design scenarios to minimize cost and balance with capacity.

As a Data Scientist, you’ll work with large fulfillment datasets using SQL, R, Python, and Julia to identify business insights and opportunities for process improvement. The Data Scientist will extract key findings and suggestions to support decision making.

The Data Science team also mentors junior analysts in developing analytic models in supply chain, and work cross-functionally with Tech, Finance to deliver cost reduction or efficiency improvement plans.

Who We Are

You will join the Corporate Operations team that sits in the very center of the overall Zulily Supply Chain.
You will have the opportunity to work cross-functionally with Fulfillment Center, Transportation, Vendor, Finance, and Technology teams across multiple Qurate brands.
You will help transform our Supply Chain into an optimally efficient network that helps deliver the lowest price for our customers.

Your Impact

You'll work with stakeholders to define business questions, success criteria, and model deployment plans. You'll be checking in regularly with stakeholders during projects
You will construct analytic data sets for both exploration and modeling
You will conduct exploratory data analysis and prepares visualizations summarizing key features of the data
You be researching and adapting existing open-source algorithms, when possible, develops novel techniques when needed
You'll develop reproducible information products and modular, instrumented software
You'll be expected to develop accurate models for prediction and inference
You will provide guidance to software development engineers on production implementations

What You Bring

Bachelor’s Degree in Statistics/Ops, Research/CS
Master’s Degree in Data Science/Analytics preferred
Minimum 2 years’ experience working with real data sets in a business setting
Ability to distill and present complex concepts to a business audience
Knowledge of for-profit business operations

Convoy is transforming the $800 billion trucking industry, where even 10 years ago, most truck drivers did not have smartphones and paper driver logs were common. In 2015, Convoy launched the digital freight movement with an open and fully connected marketplace for brands and manufacturers to work directly with freight carriers who move truckload shipments throughout the country. This ‘Digital Freight Network’ is powered by machine learning and automation, and supported by a broad, ever-growing set of features that benefit both sides of the marketplace.
We’ve been honored to work with some great companies, such as Unilever, The Home Depot, and Procter & Gamble. We’ve also been backed by world-class investors, including Google, YCombinator, Fidelity, Greylock Generation, Lone Pine, T. Rowe Price, Baillie Gifford and the founders and CEOs of Amazon, Salesforce, eBay, LinkedIn, Expedia, Dropbox, Starbucks, and others. We are proud to have been named a CNBC Disruptor 50 Winner (3x), a Fast Company World Changing Idea, a LinkedIn Top Startup, a Forbes' Best Startup Employer, one of Fortune Magazine's 'Impact 20' list, a best place to work in Washington State, a BloombergNEF Pioneer winner, and more.
This is your opportunity to collaborate with an incredible group of people and help transform the freight industry. Join Convoy and help us transport the world with endless capacity and zero waste.
About you:
You are passionate about Associate development, problem solving and customer service. You have experience working in a fast paced environment with competing priorities. You enjoy creating and executing strategic growth plans for your business area. You will help onboard and supervise the continued performance of a team of Operations Associates. You’ll play an integral role in setting culture and will bring the energy, grit, and work ethic necessary to get the job done!
Note: This shift will be Monday-Friday, and you will need to be flexible with the shift hours.
You will:
Support training and onboarding Operations Associates
Provide daily direction and communication to the team to ensure SLAs are met with high quality service
Create and maintain a positive, energetic work environment so team members are motivated to perform at their highest level
Partner with our Supply and Demand teams to execute ction plans for accounts and company initiatives
Perform ongoing process and procedure evaluation, improvement, and training
Assist Operations Manager with development, analyses and implementation of staffing, training, scheduling and reward/recognition programs
We're looking for someone who has:
A Bachelor's Degree from an accredited university

Convoy is an equal-opportunity employer and we welcome applicants from all backgrounds. If you’re a passionate team player who wants to have an outsized impact on a diverse and dynamic team, we’d love to hear from you!

The Opportunity

As a Data Scientist, you’ll use optimization, integer and dynamic programming, simulation, and machine learning techniques to better understand the interactions within our Fulfillment Centers, and use that information to increase efficiency and reduce order cycle times. You’ll work with key stakeholders to crisply define business questions, success criteria, and deployment plans. You’ll use reproducible research techniques to create analytical data sets, conduct exploratory data analysis, select, and engineer features, train, tune, and evaluate candidate models, and distill and present findings.

You will help optimize Fulfillment Center layouts and processes by using simulation methodologies, such as deterministic simulation, stochastic simulation, and Monte Carlo simulation, to capture the entire process from SKU inbound to and outbound from the Fulfillment Centers. You will provide test results in different Fulfillment Center re-design scenarios to minimize cost and balance with capacity.

As a Data Scientist, you’ll work with large fulfillment datasets using SQL, R, Python, and Julia to identify business insights and opportunities for process improvement. The Data Scientist will extract key findings and suggestions to support decision making.

The Data Science team also mentors junior analysts in developing analytic models in supply chain, and work cross-functionally with Tech, Finance to deliver cost reduction or efficiency improvement plans.

Who We Are

You will join the Corporate Operations team that sits in the very center of the overall Zulily Supply Chain.
You will have the opportunity to work cross-functionally with Fulfillment Center, Transportation, Vendor, Finance, and Technology teams across multiple Qurate brands.
You will help transform our Supply Chain into an optimally efficient network that helps deliver the lowest price for our customers.

Your Impact

You'll work with stakeholders to define business questions, success criteria, and model deployment plans. You'll be checking in regularly with stakeholders during projects
You will construct analytic data sets for both exploration and modeling
You will conduct exploratory data analysis and prepares visualizations summarizing key features of the data
You be researching and adapting existing open-source algorithms, when possible, develops novel techniques when needed
You'll develop reproducible information products and modular, instrumented software
You'll be expected to develop accurate models for prediction and inference
You will provide guidance to software development engineers on production implementations

What You Bring

Bachelor’s Degree in Statistics/Ops, Research/CS
Master’s Degree in Data Science/Analytics preferred
Minimum 2 years’ experience working with real data sets in a business setting
Ability to distill and present complex concepts to a business audience
Knowledge of for-profit business operations

Convoy is transforming the $800 billion trucking industry, where even 10 years ago, most truck drivers did not have smartphones and paper driver logs were common. In 2015, Convoy launched the digital freight movement with an open and fully connected marketplace for brands and manufacturers to work directly with freight carriers who move truckload shipments throughout the country. This ‘Digital Freight Network’ is powered by machine learning and automation, and supported by a broad, ever-growing set of features that benefit both sides of the marketplace.
We’ve been honored to work with some great companies, such as Unilever, The Home Depot, and Procter & Gamble. We’ve also been backed by world-class investors, including Google, YCombinator, Fidelity, Greylock Generation, Lone Pine, T. Rowe Price, Baillie Gifford and the founders and CEOs of Amazon, Salesforce, eBay, LinkedIn, Expedia, Dropbox, Starbucks, and others. We are proud to have been named a CNBC Disruptor 50 Winner (3x), a Fast Company World Changing Idea, a LinkedIn Top Startup, a Forbes' Best Startup Employer, one of Fortune Magazine's 'Impact 20' list, a best place to work in Washington State, a BloombergNEF Pioneer winner, and more.
This is your opportunity to collaborate with an incredible group of people and help transform the freight industry. Join Convoy and help us transport the world with endless capacity and zero waste.

You enjoy creating and executing strategic growth plans for your business area. You will help onboard and supervise the continued performance of a team of Operations Associates. You’ll play an integral role in setting culture and will bring the energy, grit, and work ethic necessary to get the job done!
Note: This shift will be Monday-Friday, and you will need to be flexible with the shift hours.

Support training and onboarding Operations Associates

Create and maintain a positive, energetic work environment so team members are motivated to perform at their highest level
Partner with our Supply and Demand teams to execute ction plans for accounts and company initiatives
Perform ongoing process and procedure evaluation, improvement, and training
Assist Operations Manager with development, analyses and implementation of staffing, training, scheduling and reward/recognition programs

PhD or equivalent Master's degree plus 4+ years of experience in a quantitative filed
1+ years of experience formulating and solving predictive modeling, machine learning, forecasting or statistical modeling problems

Are you interested in the world’s largest Cloud Network? Are you interested in applying new methods to extremely hard problems? Do you want to play a key role in the future of AWS’s infrastructure? Come and join us! The Network Capacity Science team is looking for Scientists to join our team. Our team owns multiple forecasts and tools that drive the decision-making behind the world's largest Network, and we are looking for excellent Scientists that can help us answer tough and ambiguous questions. Working collaboratively, you will improve and develop solutions to complex problems, such as forecasting the Network traffic across Data-Centers worldwide, or forecasting how much physical growth our infrastructure will see in the next decade. You will work with a team of Scientist and Software Engineers among others to test your solutions and push them into production so the business can meet its goals.

About Us
Inclusive Team Culture
Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have ten employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 14 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.
Work/Life Balance
Our team puts a high value on work-life balance. It isn’t about how many hours you spend at home or at work; it’s about the flow you establish that brings energy to both parts of your life. We believe striking the right balance between your personal and professional life is critical to life-long happiness and fulfillment. We offer flexibility in working hours and encourage you to find your own balance between your work and personal lives.
Mentorship & Career Growth
Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. Our senior members enjoy one-on-one mentoring and thorough, but kind, code reviews. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded engineer and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.


PhD or equivalent Master's degree plus 5+ years of experience in a quantitative filed
Experience formulating and solving predictive modeling, machine learning, forecasting or statistical modeling problems
Experience working in very large scale problems and applying simple solutions that demonstrate deep understanding of the problems
Experience investigating the feasibility of applying scientific concepts to business problems and products
3+ years of experience in the following skill(s): R, MATLAB, or SAS or major programming language such as Python, Java, C++, C#, or C
Prior work experience and/or academic research in area of Time Series, Network Modelling or equivalent
Superior verbal and written communication and presentation skills, ability to convey rigorous mathematical concepts and considerations to non-experts

About ByteDance
Founded in 2012, ByteDance is a technology company operating a range of content platforms that inform, educate, entertain and inspire people across languages, cultures and geographies.

With a suite of more than a dozen products, including TikTok, Douyin, Toutiao, Helo and Resso, ByteDance now has a portfolio of applications available in over 150 markets and 75 languages.

We focus on conducting cutting-edge research and development in the area of Computer Graphics, Computer Vision, Augmented Reality and Deep Learning, and continuously transfer innovative technologies to various ByteDance products. We are looking for talents at all levels to join us on this exciting journey!


Conduct cutting-edge research and development in automatically or manually design neural architectures, do hyperparameter tuning, and model compression/optimization.
Apply automated machine learning algorithms to improve existing machine models in different systems including but not limited to computer vision tasks on mobile phones and GPU servers.
Advanced research experience on neural networks architecture, neural architecture search, hyperparameter tuning, model compressions, model quantization, Bayesian optimization or reinforcement learning (preferring candidates with publications in top-tier venues such as CVPR, ICCV, ECCV, ICML, NeurIPS, ICLR, JMLR).
Master or PhD in computer science, electrical engineering or related fields.
Solid knowledge and experience with at least one major deep learning framework (e.g. PyTorch, Tensorflow, MXNet, Caffe/Caffe2, PaddlePaddle).
Familiar with deep neural network architectures such as CNN/RNN/LSTM etc.
Strong analytical and problem solving skills.
Ability to work collaboratively in multi-functional teams.

ByteDance is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At ByteDance, our mission is to inspire creativity and enrich life. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We believe individuals shouldn't be disadvantaged because of their background or identity, but instead should be considered based on their strengths and experience. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.

ByteDance is committed to providing reasonable accommodations during our recruitment process. If you need assistance or an accommodation, please reach out to us at USRC@bytedance.com.

At KenSci, we obsess over a very simple problem – How can we make healthcare better using data. We are a diverse group of Data Scientists, Doctors, Engineers and Customer focused individuals on a path to building an important and meaningful technology company. With explainable AI models for healthcare, KenSci is making risk-based prediction more efficient, accountable, and cost effective. Our team is constantly working to solve complex problems and have created a risk prediction platform that helps health systems identify population risk and optimize clinical outcomes and operational efficiency across the care continuum.

Here at KenSci we have a “Come as you are” mentality. Although we are proud to call Seattle home, we have smart, fun, creative people stretched across the globe. KenSci believes our people are our best asset. That’s why our benefits are amazing, and our work life balance is unheard of! We lead with empathy, get things done quickly and work as a family.

Role

We are currently looking for passionate data scientists to join our team and mission. In this role, you will help doctors from across the world improve care and save lives by helping extract insights and predict risk. KenSci’s data scientists are the heart of our risk prediction platform and we’re looking for smart individuals to join our incredibly talented team that is on a mission to transform healthcare.
Responsibilities

Apply state of the art machine learning knowledge to the healthcare domain to identify solutions to healthcare problems.
Work with large data sets, integrate diverse data sources, data types and data structures into the solution.
Develop analytical approaches to meet business requirements; this involves translating requests into use cases, test cases, preparation of training data sets and iterative algorithm development.
Collaborate with various stakeholders such as Doctors, Nurses, Business Consultants, Product Management, and Clients on the formulation and application of new modeling solutions for a variety of healthcare related problems.
Provide leadership to find solutions to problems that are impediments to health systems.
Engage in deep research and identify new predictive modeling techniques as appropriate for a specific solution
Present research results as well as recommendations internally as well as to customers.
Lead teams that present KenSci’s research at leading conferences and academic sessions.
Performs exploratory data analysis to gauge the need for or appropriateness of advanced analytical methods.
Mentor/coach team members to further develop their skills.


Requirements

Masters or PhD in Mathematics, Computer Science, Statistics, or related field.
At least 5 years of industry experience building machine learning models.
Expert understanding of machine learning concepts and techniques.
Advanced proficiency in working with multiple data science tools & languages (Python, R, Pandas, Spark etc.) .
Expertise in one or more query languages (SQL, Hive, Pig etc.).
Understanding of Software Development Life Cycle.
Strong applied statistics skills.
Strong cross discipline communication skills.
Demonstrate a continuous learning mind and seek development opportunities


KenSci is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or other medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics.

For a century, Wilbur-Ellis has experienced success and growth in marketing and distributing agricultural products and services. Join us and grow your career with a strong and profitable industry leader offering competitive compensation, tremendous growth and development opportunities, and a people-first work environment. Come grow with us!

The world population is expected to grow to 10 billion by 2050 which will require a 70% increase in food production. The agriculture industry sees increased attention from technology innovators and venture capitalists in recent years to meet this challenge. Wilbur-Ellis is a leader in precision agriculture technology innovation and has a world-class software development team working on the industry-leading product 'AgVerdict' and customer-facing digital platform. AgVerdict software platform combines soil fertility data, satellite imagery, real-time weather and sensor data, machine data, geospatial data, scouting data, and data from many more sources to help farmers make the right decisions planting to harvest to maximize yield. The visionary management team at Wilbur-Ellis is actively collaborating and partnering with leading technology providers in Silicon Valley and across the country to ensure farmers have the latest technology at their fingertips.

General Purpose and Scope of Position:

We are looking for a talented Program Manager who shares our passion for building innovative products to solve complex problems in the agriculture domain. The position will report to the Principal PM Manager.

Key Skills and Abilities Include:

B.S. in a technical discipline or equivalent experience
2-3 years of Software development and program management experience
Strong product, technology, and customer focus
Passionate about user experience (UX)
Strong communication, organization, and management skills
Excellent people skills and ability to work with cross-functional teams
Knowledge of software development processes and Agile
Experience in collaboration with external technology partners
Self-motivated, proactive with demonstrated creative and critical thinking capabilities
A desire for learning and growing

Key Personal Attributes Include:

Ability to work individually and as part of a team in a diverse environment
Experience and desire to work in a global delivery environment
Highly motivated, curious, organized, detail-oriented, team player
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills to facilitate troubleshooting

Specific Responsibilities and Key Deliverables Include:

Identify customer needs, articulate problem statements, dig into data, propose effective solutions.
Manage software development projects and features.
Work on designing software solutions/features to problems.
Focus on user experience (UX) and create mockups/sketches.
Work with teams to identify solutions to overcome roadblocks and mitigate risks.
Create stories/specifications for the engineering teams for various features.
Participate in technical discussions about feature design and implementation.
Make sure the projects are on track and identify any bottlenecks and risks.
Report progress and status of projects.
Discover and articulate technical requirements and dependencies.
Develop and optimize training plans and evangelize the product.
Coordinate the release of the software and keep a pulse on customer issues.
Participate in optimizing the software development process.
Be the scrum master for scrum teams.

Compensation and Benefits:

Competitive salary (to be determined based on experience and other factors)
Benefits package (medical, dental, vision, 401k, Employee Assistance Program, vacation, sick time, life insurance, + more); pension plan, 401k match up to 3%
Drug-Free Workplace


If you are currently a Wilbur-Ellis employee, please notify your Manager prior to applying for this position. Thank you!


COMPANY CULTURE

Wilbur-Ellis is a company you can be proud to call your employer

Wilbur-Ellis markets and distributes agricultural products, animal feed, and specialty chemicals, and food ingredients. A privately held and consistently profitable company, we employ more than 4,000 people throughout North America and Asia-Pacific.

Wilbur-Ellis is for and about people

Wilbur-Ellis has enjoyed 100 years of success and growth, all thanks to our people. Our employees are both leaders and team players who thrive on creativity, entrepreneurial spirit, and a dedication to quality work, our customers, and each other.

Wilbur-Ellis invests in the industry’s best workforce

Wilbur-Ellis invests heavily in our employees by offering skill development and training, competitive compensation and benefits, and a tradition of promoting from within for a broad range of career opportunities. And we foster a supportive, people-first work environment.

JobTitle: Sr. Technical Program Manager - Machine Learning
Content_text:
7+ years of experience working directly with engineering teams
Experience managing projects across cross functional teams, building sustainable processes and coordinating release schedules
5+ years of technical program management experience
3+ years of experience working directly with data analytics / machine learning teams.
Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative or engineering field (Computer Science, Machine Learning, Statistics, etc.).

Do you want to protect the shopping experience of hundreds of millions of Amazon customers and contribute millions of dollars directly to Amazon's bottom line? Do you feel excited about applying cutting-edge Machine Learning techniques to solve real-world problems? Do you enjoy a diverse, collaborative and inclusive team environment? Join Amazon’s Payment Risk Machine Learning (ML) team to prevent fraudulent and abusive transactions across every Amazon product line.

Who are we looking for?

We are looking for passionate Sr. Technical Program Managers (TPMs) to work with our bright ML scientists and engineers on the best-in-class risk management systems. This is a highly visible role that requires substantial business acumen as well as technical depth. If you are passionate about innovation, want to have organization-wide impact, and are looking for opportunities to drive key ML-related programs from idea all the way to production, we look forward to talking to you.

What will you be doing?

In this role, you will be responsible for scoping and delivering large end-to-end ML-related projects. This requires one to:

Collect business and technical requirements from internal and external customers.
Write business requirement documents and specifications.
Clarify ambiguities along the road. Define delivery scope, timeline, roadmap, and milestones clearly and properly.
Estimate project impact and development effort. Make appropriate trade-offs to optimize return-on-investment and make the best use of resources.
Coordinate with cross-functional teams (e.g., ML scientists, engineers, operation teams, product managers, etc.). Manage the delivery timeline and drive the development progress.
Communicate project status to a broad audience including senior management.
Proactively identify risks, bottlenecks, and roadblocks. Initiate technical deep dives and/or organize working sessions to solve problems and mitigate risks.
Develop, summarize, and promote best practices.
Brainstorm innovative ideas and push the boundaries of ML technology.

This is a unique opportunity for qualified candidates to drive the entire life cycle of highly impactful, real-world ML applications at scale.

About the team
The Buyer Risk Prevention team under the Customer Trust and Partner Support (CTPS) organization is a central place in Amazon that protects our customers and all Amazon’s businesses from account take-over, fraud, and abuse. Specifically, the Payment Risk Machine Learning team protects Amazon and its customers from fraud and abuse by developing machine learning models and applying cutting-edge technologies to the order pipelines of all Amazon businesses, including but not limited to Amazon.com, Amazon Physical stores, Amazon Pay, etc.

ML is changing the world in fundamental ways. Fraud prevention nowadays is heavily dependent on ML and data driven strategies, which we use to outsmart bad actors. We want you to join us in this journey, applying the most advanced ML techniques to keep Amazon the safest and most trusted place in the world for our customers.


Understand Machine Learning techniques in breadth and depth. Has the ability to break-down complex business requirements and technical issues related to ML applications. Previous hands-on experience in machine learning, predictive modeling, and/or large-scale data analysis is preferred.
Superb communication skills, including both written and verbal. You will own key documents for the team that will be shared with partner teams and senior leadership. Previous experience in a customer-facing or technical consulting role is a plus.
Ability to bring clarity to ambiguous issues and make appropriate trade-offs to optimize overall impact, time-to-deliver, and resource utilization. Previous technical program managing experience is preferred, but you could also have acquired the expertise by other means.
Analytical ability to proactively identify risks, bottlenecks, and opportunities for improvement, both at the project level and at the team level. You will need to engage with the stakeholders and senior management to resolve these issues and seek continuous improvement of the program.

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.

At Boeing, we innovate and collaborate to make the world a better place. From the seabed to outer space, you can contribute to work that matters with a company where diversity, equity and inclusion are shared values. We’re committed to fostering an environment for every teammate that’s welcoming, respectful and inclusive, with great opportunity for professional growth. Find your future with us.
Boeing is currently looking for two Senior Machine Learning Perception Technologists to join their team in Seattle, WA (Huntsville, AL).
About Us: As the advanced central research and development organization of The Boeing Company, Boeing Research & Technology (BR&T) incubates creative ideas for tomorrow’s world, designs, creates, and provides innovative technologies that enable the development of future aerospace solutions while improving existing Boeing products and services.
Employees work in a dynamic and distributed environment where the initiative and contribution of each researcher and technologist is critical to success. The ideal candidate will be able to work independently and as part of a distributed (and international) team. Many projects are multi-year and end with the successful transition and integration of new capabilities to Boeing end product development/deployment. Project work can be funded by Independent Research and Development, Contracted Research and Development, or support to a Business Unit.
A successful candidate for this position will be an experienced and motivated Machine Learning Researcher, Technologist, or Engineer with depth in Perception. They will have strong background and skills in mathematics, probabilities and statistics. Meanwhile, they will be an enterprise technical leader, mentor, and consultant. They will lead research and development (R&D) by rapidly prototyping advanced systems for aerospace products and services. They will have broad knowledge of Machine Learning techniques. They will be comfortable in taking initiative, learning from others and by experience, seeking feedback, and creating innovative ideas. They will get great satisfaction in applying and engineering solutions that will work in the real world.
Position Responsibilities:
Develops machine learning and perception ideas and systems for aerospace products and services
Understands the mathematics of their methods and the systems that they work on
Adapts and integrates various hardware and software capabilities into workable prototypes
Ability to design, create, and evaluate new or modified data analysis algorithms to meet application requirements, such as statistical analysis, machine learning, natural language processing, text mining, visual analytics.
Ability to perform research on sensor data, image processing and fusion, high fidelity world perception modeling of systems and man-machine interfaces.
Knowledge of science and technologies involved in modeling and simulating the physical and/or data environment in such a way that a computer can correctly interpret it and computationally reason on it.
Effectively communicates results to teammates and customers.
Demonstrates creativity and interest in personal learning and development.
Seeks feedback from multiple sources to improve and develop.
Comfortable in taking initiative and learning by experience.
The position must meet Export Control compliance requirements, therefore a “US Person” as defined by 22 C.F.R. § 120.15 is required. “US Person” includes US Citizen, lawful permanent resident, refugee, or asylee.
Basic Qualifications (Required Skills/Experience):
Experience developing, analyzing, and deploying Artificial Intelligence and related algorithms
10+ years of software development experience
5+ years of machine learning experience in developing and evaluating learned models
5+ years of experience preparing data to create learned models
Experience with scripting languages for prototyping
Experience with high level programming languages such a C++, C, Java
Experience with Computer Vision and Deep Learning techniques
Preferred Qualifications (Desired Skills/Experience):
PhD degree preferred in Computer Science or similar
Strong knowledge of mathematics, probability theory and statistics
Knowledge of data structure, numerical optimization and algorithm complexity
Experience with Machine Learning development and deployment pipeline, i.e. from data to model
Experience in machine learning
Experience in multi-modal sensor data fusion and visualization technologies are necessary for the position
Experience with machine learning libraries, such as TensorFlow, Keras, PyTorch.
Experience with computer vision libraries such as OpenCV, PCL, or ROS
Experience with software frameworks such as the Robot Operating System (ROS)
Experience with sensors (cameras, LiDAR, GPS-IMU), embedded systems, and system integration related physical systems
Experience with Linux OS
Experience with Agile methodology and repositories, such as JIRA and Git
Experience in Augmented Reality and image recognition technologies
Publication to his/her credit in areas of machine learning and AI.
Typical Education & Experience: Typically 14 or more years related work experience or relevant military experience. Advanced degree in computer science or similar is preferred but not required.
Relocation:
This position offers relocation based on candidate eligibility.
Drug Free Workplace:
Boeing is a Drug Free Workplace where post offer applicants and employees are subject to testing for marijuana, cocaine, opioids, amphetamines, PCP, and alcohol when criteria is met as outlined in our policies.
At Boeing, we strive to deliver a Total Rewards package that will attract, engage and retain the top talent. Elements of the Total Rewards package include competitive base pay and variable compensation opportunities.
The Boeing Company also provides eligible employees with an opportunity to enroll in a variety of benefit programs, generally including health insurance, flexible spending accounts, health savings accounts, retirement savings plans, life and disability insurance programs, and a number of programs that provide for both paid and unpaid time away from work.
The specific programs and options available to any given employee may vary depending on eligibility factors such as geographic location, date of hire, and the applicability of collective bargaining agreements.
Please note that the salary information shown below is a general guideline only. Salaries are based upon candidate experience and qualifications, as well as market and business considerations.
Summary pay range: $103,950– $193,050
Vaccination Requirements:
Boeing is implementing new requirements for employees to be fully vaccinated from COVID-19 or have an approved reasonable accommodation based on local legislation in several countries including U.S.-based employees. Please refer here for current vaccination and/or reasonable accommodation requirements, and timelines based on location.
Equal Opportunity Employer:
Boeing is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, physical or mental disability, genetic factors, military/veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.

If you’re looking for an impactful opportunity to use technology and enable strategic business decision making, then, this role in Worldwide Incentive Compensation may just be your next great career adventure!
Microsoft is on a mission to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. Our culture is centered on embracing a growth mindset, a theme of inspiring excellence, and encouraging teams and leaders to bring their best each day. In doing so, we create life-changing innovations that impact billions of lives around the world. You can help us to achieve our mission.
The Mission and The Team
The Microsoft Customer & Partner Solutions (MCAPS) organization unifies the commercial go to market organization to accelerate our progress, stay true to the Microsoft mission, and empower our customers, partners, people, and Microsoft’s growth. The Strategy & Operations (S&O) team empowers the entire MCAPS organization. Strategy & Operations team is chartered with:
Leading the development and orchestration of our Commercial strategy and operating model,
Ensuring our global organization can serve our customers and partners more effectively, efficiently, and with competitive differentiation, and
Delivering measurable impact by our ability to grow faster and take share – empowering our people to be more agile, successful, and thrilled to work for Microsoft.
Our sellers are key to how customers and partners understand Microsoft’s products and strategies, but how do we align the conversations of thousands of sellers with each other and with the company’s strategy? Within Strategy & Operations, the Worldwide Incentive Compensation (WWIC) team connects strategy to seller behavior in one of the most important ways: by determining how sellers get paid. The WWIC mission is to Enable Strategy, Motivate Sellers, Reward Results. In pursuit of this mission, the team designs and implements variable incentive-based compensation plans for more than 30,000 sellers, sales leaders, and consultants across Microsoft. We are experts in Sales Incentive Compensation at Microsoft, responsible for aligning incentive plans and targets (quotas) to motivate seller behavior and drive the company's strategies. We are also the end-to-end owners of incentive compensation processes and data which includes quota setting management, delivering timely and accurate payouts, providing business insights based upon performance of sellers to field/segment leaders and executives, business partnering with the field/segments on Incentive Compensation topics, and driving continuous process improvement through review and analysis of incentive compensation performance.
The Business Analytics Specialist-BI Developer is responsible for delivering the BI, Tools and Reporting needs for the WWIC organization to enable sales compensation design / planning, quota management, analytical modeling and performance management. The ideal candidate excels having the ability to understand the business strategy and align the data/tools and reporting to provide rich insights and support data driven decisions.
Responsibilities
Identify, design, and implement internal process improvements: automating manual processes, optimizing data delivery, re-designing infrastructure for greater scalability, etc.
Understand the process, data structure and tools across the organization and seek for simplification, user experience improvement applying a data driven approach.
Create and maintain optimal data architecture. Liaise with upstream data providers to ensure quality, reliability and timeliness of the data feeds that go into the reporting platform.
Build the infrastructure required for optimal extraction, transformation, and loading of data from a wide variety of data sources using relevant tools, for e.g., SQL, Azure, and other ‘big data’ technologies.
Keep data separated and secure following relevant national/international boundaries, while maintaining PII and Compliant data Security practices. Oversees data expiry practices and establishes and implements processes for data archival and expiry.
Understand the business strategy and implement changes to the tools and reporting to provide scalable and timely insights to enable data driven decisions. Work with sales compensation analysts, plan design and implementation, field advisors and other WWIC teams to support their data related technical issues and data infrastructure needs.
Bridge gap between technology trends and business needs and adopt best possible platform/techniques to ensure the reporting lands smoothly and in timely fashion.
Strives for high quality service, innovation, and high efficiency in delivery
Nurture and mentor Data Engineers to maintain speed, agility, and quality.
Define KPI for measuring the success of operations and partner with the teams to ensure it lands
Qualifications
5+ years of progressive work experience designing, architecting scalable systems to handle process, data, and reporting.
3+ years of experience with 2 or more of the following tools:
Azure BI offerings (like Azure data factory, Power BI, Synapse, Machine learning) or equivalent technology
Python
SQL development
Experience in working with fast paced development, modern DevOps approach using GIT, CI/CD Automation
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Informatics, Information Systems, or another quantitative field. Master’s preferred.
Demonstrated collaboration and proven ability to work effectively in a large, geo dispersed, and virtual team environment.
Provide skills in effective stakeholder management across organizational boundaries. Building strong relationships, deep understanding of the business needs, strategic thinking and problem-solving skills
Demonstrated ability to work in ambiguous situations. Can effectively cope with change, shift gears comfortably, decide and act without having the total picture and comfortably handle risk and uncertainty.
Excellent written and oral communication skills, particularly the ability to synthesize complex issues/scenarios into easy-to-understand concepts.
Drive for results having high attention to details and self-discipline.
Experience in leading virtual team of data engineers.
The salary for this role in the state of Colorado is between $113,900 and $171,500.
At Microsoft, certain roles are eligible for additional rewards, including annual bonus and stock. These awards are allocated based on individual performance. In addition, certain roles also have the opportunity to earn sales incentives based on revenue or utilization, depending on the terms of the plan and the employee’s role.
Benefits/perks listed here may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work.US-based employees gain access to healthcare benefits, a 401(k) plan and company match, short-term and long-term disability coverage, basic life insurance, and fitness benefits, among others.
Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via the Accommodation request form.

JobTitle: Research & Sourcing Recruiter- Amazon Incubator (Multiple Lo...
Content_text:
Market Research experience
Knowledge of Boolean, x-ray searches and additional sourcing software/tools
Prior experience managing and prioritizing multiple searches, projects and customer relationships
Prior experience working with recruiting and people-related tools and systems, including applicant tracking systems, resume databases, internet sourcing tools
Experience with interview and offer management
Experience building close relationships with clients as a trusted recruiting business leader and partner

The Amazon Incubator recruiting team supports the growth and expansion of a unique team that seeds, develop and scales new and novel products for Amazon.

With the growth and expansion of new products, we are looking for an experienced Technical recruiter who will align with one of these key new product vertices.

As a Technical Recruiter, you will lead the top of the funnel market research, insights and engagement for technical and unique talent. You will work with the client leaders and business partners by sharing findings that will inform the overall growth strategy of the team. You will contribute to the measure of success, including key goals, benchmarks and metrics that align with the overarching goals of the business.

This is an excellent opportunity for talent acquisition professionals interested in deep dive market knowledge, programs and special projects. Our domain focus directly aligns with technical expertise in Engineering, Data Science, Machine Learning, Computer Vision, Artificial Intelligence and Design.

Our team culture is goal-oriented, fast paced and fun! We are motivated by the challenge (and success) of hiring top talent for the ever expanding and innovative products.

Please note that we are open to multiple locations: NY, Boston, Austin, Bay Area and Seattle. Candidates with prior domain experience will be considered for remote positions.

Key responsibilities include:

Partnering with the business leadership and lead recruiters to build effective outreach, assessment and delivery strategies to attract bar raising talent
Market insights, outreach strategy and creative marketing to attract unique talent
Partnering with adjacent recruiting teams to drive internal operational efficiencies and specialized search initiatives such as candidate experience & DEI growth

Here at Amazon, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have ten employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 14 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.

Work/life Balance

Our team puts a high value on work-life balance. It isn’t about how many hours you spend at home or at work; it’s about the flow you establish that brings energy to both parts of your life. We believe striking the right balance between your personal and professional life is critical to life-long happiness and fulfillment. We offer flexibility in working hours and encourage you to find your own balance between your work and personal lives.

Mentorship & Career Growth

Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. Our senior members enjoy one-on-one mentoring and thorough, but kind, code reviews. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded engineer and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.


Prior experience working with recruiting and people-related tools and systems, including applicant tracking systems, resume databases, internet sourcing tools
Creative sourcing strategic experience
Understanding of tracking, measuring and implimeting recruiting data into daily workflow
