Company Description
Since 2004, Mandiant has been a trusted partner to security-conscious organizations. Effective security is based on the right combination of expertise, intelligence, and adaptive technology, and the Mandiant Advantage SaaS platform scales decades of frontline experience and industry-leading threat intelligence to deliver a range of dynamic cyber defense solutions. Mandiant’s approach helps organizations develop more effective and efficient cyber security programs and instills confidence in their readiness to defend against and respond to cyber threats.

Job Description
What You'll Do:
If you dream of a job working in a field where all the hard problems are solved and you get to re-use previous research to get your job done, you need not apply. If, however, you are someone who wants to tackle problems that truly are on the cutting edge, then we encourage you to keep reading.
Data Science is an emerging field within cyber security. Mandiant, given its deep expertise and comprehensive view on the advanced threat landscape, is uniquely positioned to enable data scientists to have major impact within our industry, company, and across our customer base. Detecting security breaches using machine learning and data analytics is an unsolved problem (this is not handwriting recognition folks) and has huge potential.
If you are someone who wants to be on the cutting edge of a high profile industry, who wants to make an impact by pushing both fields of data science and cyber security forward, you may be the perfect candidate to help us on our mission.
Responsibilities
As a senior staff engineer on the Data Science team, you will:
Design, develop, and manage highly scalable, reliable and fault tolerant distributed data systems to ingest and process data at massive scale
Identify data sources both internally and externally that we can use to find evil.
Architect and design software solutions for long-term storage and retrieval.
Identify and implement data exploration technologies. Create dashboards and implement analytical tools for exploration
Work with data scientists to productize ML models and assist product teams with ML model releases into end products.
Collect requirements, design, and build backend components and tools to run ML models, assess ML model efficacy, manage large scale datasets, and generate features for ML models
Contribute to the evolution of coding and design practices within the organization.
Review code base commits and contribute to the growth of team members.

Qualifications
Minimum Requirements:
Ability to work in an iterative, agile development environment.
Extensive experience in architecting reliable distributed systems.
Experience implementing ETL processes and building data pipelines
Experience in Data modeling and schema design
Strong knowledge of a variety of operating systems, networking fundamentals, software design and programming best practices.
Experience with use of a wide array of algorithms and data structures.
Deep understanding and experience of going through the entire life cycle of building software platforms and products
Deep knowledge of various AWS services and associated tools
Strong experience developing in Python 3 and Java
Experience with RDBMS, such as PostgreSQL or MySQL, as well as NoSQL databases.
Strong experience using Kubernetes and Docker.
Experience deploying products in AWS
Experience in analytical tools (Splunk, Kibana, etc.)
Ability to pick up, work with and explore new analytical tools
Strong experience with DevOps practices and common tooling
Strong communication skills.
Ability to work with loosely defined requirements.

Additional Information
At Mandiant we are committed to our #OneTeam approach combining diversity, collaboration, and excellence. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, sex, color, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or on the basis of disability.
Minimum Salary: $140,000. Final salary will be determined commensurately with cost of living, experience level, and/or any other legally permissible considerations.
Incentive Compensation: Eligibility for annual bonus subject to individual and company performance; eligibility for award of Restricted Stock Units subject to eligibility requirements, approval from FireEye’s Compensation Committee, and vesting terms
Benefits: Employer subsidized benefits include Medical, Dental, Vision, Life, and Disability Insurance. Subject to eligibility requirements, FireEye also offers the ability to participate in 401(k), Flexible Spending Accounts, Health Savings Accounts, Dependent Care Spending Accounts, and Employee Stock Purchase Program. FireEye also provides Paid Time Off, Flexible Paid Sick Time, and Paid Holidays.
Disclosure as required by sb19-085 (8-5-20)

JobTitle: Applied AI ML - Machine Learning Center of Excellence - Seni...
Content_text:
Applied AI ML opportunities are available at Sr. Associate, Vice President and Executive Director level in New York, Palo Alto and Seattle, WA locations.
Machine Learning Scientist CIB Data & Analytics - Machine Learning Center of Excellence - Senior Associate / Vice President / Executive Director
The Machine Learning Center of Excellence is a world-class machine learning team continually advancing state-of-the-art methods to solve a wide range of real-world financial problems using the company's vast and unique datasets. The successful candidate will apply sophisticated machine learning methods to a wide variety of complex tasks including natural language processing, speech analytics, time series, reinforcement learning and recommendation systems. The candidate must excel in working in a highly collaborative environment together with the business, technologists and control partners to deploy solutions into production. The candidate must also have a strong passion for machine learning and invest independent time towards learning, researching and experimenting with new innovations in the field. The candidate must have solid expertise in Deep Learning with hands-on implementation experience and possess strong analytical thinking, a deep desire to learn and be highly motivated.
The Machine Learning Center of Excellence is a world-class machine learning team continually advancing state-of-the-art methods to solve a wide range of real-world financial problems using the company's vast and unique datasets.
Our work spans across all of J.P. Morgan's lines of business including Investment Banking, Asset Management and Consumer Banking, through every part of the organization from front office, operations, technology, finance and more. With this unparalleled access to the firm, the role offers a unique opportunity to explore novel and complex challenges that could profoundly transform how the bank operates.
The successful candidate will apply sophisticated machine learning methods to a wide variety of complex tasks including natural language processing, speech analytics, time series, reinforcement learning and recommendation systems. The candidate must excel in working in a highly collaborative environment together with the business, technologists and control partners to deploy solutions into production. The candidate must also have a strong passion for machine learning and invest independent time towards learning, researching and experimenting with new innovations in the field. The candidate must have solid expertise in Deep Learning with hands-on implementation experience and possess strong analytical thinking, a deep desire to learn and be highly motivated.
Responsibilities

Research and explore new machine learning methods through independent study, attending industry-leading conferences, experimentation and participating in our knowledge sharing community
Develop state-of-the art machine learning models to solve real-world problems and apply it to tasks such as NLP, speech recognition, time-series predictions or recommendation systems
Collaborate with multiple partner teams such as Business, Technology, Product Management, Legal, Compliance, Strategy and Business Management to deploy solutions into production
Lead your own project, from feasibility assessment and research through to model development

Minimum Qualifications

PhD in a quantitative discipline, e.g. Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Mathematics, Operations Research, Optimization, or Data Science. Or an MS with at least three years of industry or research experience in the field.
Hands-on experience and solid understanding of machine learning and deep learning methods
Solid background in time series analysis, speech recognition or NLP
Extensive experience with machine learning and deep learning toolkits (e.g.: TensorFlow, PyTorch, NumPy, Scikit-Learn, Pandas)
Scientific thinking and the ability to invent
Ability to design experiments and training frameworks, and to outline and evaluate intrinsic and extrinsic metrics for model performance aligned with business goals
Experience with big data and scalable model training
Solid written and spoken communication to effectively communicate technical concepts and results to both technical and business audiences
Curious, hardworking and detail-oriented, and motivated by complex analytical problems
Ability to work both independently and in highly collaborative team environments
Strong background in Mathematics and Statistics
Knowledge in Reinforcement Learning or Meta Learning
Published research in areas of Machine Learning, Deep Learning or Reinforcement Learning at a major conference or journal
Ability to develop and debug production-quality code
Familiarity with continuous integration models and unit test development
Familiarity with the financial services industry
JPMorgan Chase & Co., one of the oldest financial institutions, offers innovative financial solutions to millions of consumers, small businesses and many of the world's most prominent corporate, institutional and government clients under the J.P. Morgan and Chase brands. Our history spans over 200 years and today we are a leader in investment banking, consumer and small business banking, commercial banking, financial transaction processing and asset management.
We recognize that our people are our strength and the diverse talents they bring to our global workforce are directly linked to our success. We are an equal opportunity employer and place a high value on diversity and inclusion at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of any protected attribute, including race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital or veteran status, pregnancy or disability, or any other basis protected under applicable law. In accordance with applicable law, we make reasonable accommodations for applicants' and employees' religious practices and beliefs, as well as any mental health or physical disability needs.
The health and safety of our colleagues, candidates, clients and communities has been a top priority in light of the COVID-19 pandemic. JPMorgan Chase was awarded the "WELL Health-Safety Rating" for all of our 6,200 locations globally based on our operational policies, maintenance protocols, stakeholder engagement and emergency plans to address a post-COVID-19 environment.

As a part of our commitment to health and safety, we have implemented various COVID-related health and safety requirements for our workforce. These requirements may include sharing information in the firm's vaccine record tool, vaccination or regular testing, mask wearing, social distancing and daily health checks. Requirements may change in the future with the evolving public health landscape. JPMorgan Chase will consider accommodation requests.
Equal Opportunity Employer/Disability/Veterans

Do you want to be a part of an amazing team building the platform that creates the Azure Machine Learning? The AI Platform team at Microsoft is looking for a Senior Technical Program Manager for Azure Machine Learning (AzureML), Microsoft's ML platform for machine learning and AI professionals. The AzureML team builds the ML platform that trains and inferences some of the most demanding workloads at Microsoft like Office and Turing, 17.5B parameter natural language model, and at our customers. Within the AzureML team, you will join the Customer Engagement Team that oversees our most critical internal partnerships and will have an opportunity to build strong relationships with our Product Teams within AML.

Responsibilities
We're looking for a Senior Program Manager who can help deliver the machine learning platform which enables hyperscale growth for one of the most complex sets of workloads on earth. Someone who has demonstrated strong customer obsession and the ability to create clarity in highly ambiguous requirements and commitments across multiple teams. This individual will manage and drive cross organizational and cross Azure alignment for our internal teams. Someone who can create consensus for a product path that optimizes for our objective of being the best ML platform in the world.
Qualifications
Basic qualifications:
2+ years of managing large cross organizational engineering projects
1+ years of experience in machine learning and/or AI or experience in Azure Products and Services highly preferable in infrastructure or compute

Preferred qualifications:
Effective at driving complex multi-stakeholder processes and cross-team programs
Ability to build effective relationships, influence and collaborate at all organizational levels
Experience presenting program updates to Senior Leadership across multiple organizations
Strong verbal and written communications skills for a global audience
Strong business acumen, analytical and detail oriented
Experience creating solutions using Azure, AWS, or Google Cloud
Experience with Machine Learning platforms
Bachelor’s degree or higher
Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via the Accommodation request form.
Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work.

Position Summary...
What you'll do...
About the Role:
Success in interactive commerce requires optimizing the user experience to deliver service that delights. The research engineering team will creatively identify and leverage high quality, well-formed data to further Store No. 8's innovations through rigorous statistical/machine learning methodology and data-driven experimentation. Our ultimate goal is to create a new standard of consumer shopping with the fastest most delightful end-to-end consumer experience through Augmented Reality (AR). Our journey has just begun and we are building a hard-working passionate founding team to join us changing the retail landscape and driving technical innovation.
You’ll love this job if you:
Think of the user first and delight them in new and exciting ways
Have solid technical chops and use them to drive measurable impact to the customer and business
Can work autonomously and know how to work in a high-performing autonomous team - Think out of the box and make things happen
Thrive in loosely structured environments and help create right-fit structure as we grow
Consistently deliver and let nothing get in your way
Are flexible to the changing demands of a fast-paced startup environment
Work cross-functionally with other departments and other engineering teams to craft transparency and consensus in what you build
What you’ll do:
Design, build, train and test machine Learning models, including but not limited to the areas of Natural Language Processing (NLP),Machine Translation (MT), Speech Recognition, Image Recognition, Computer Vision (CV) and Information Retrieval (IR) - Apply state-of-the-art techniques in literature (paper/code that has been publicly available and is reproducible, including but not limited to those in reputable conferences / journals, arxiv and paperswithcode) and implement creative solutions with the data at hand, build prototypes and quickly bring value to solve business challenges.
Write code to convert your ML models into working pipelines
Work closely with product managers and engineers to frame machine Learning problems within the business context
Participate in code reviews to ensure code quality and distribute knowledge
What you should have:
3-5 years of industry experience in addition to academics MS / PhD in Computer Science or a quantitative field
Significant experience with machine learning - classification, regression and unsupervised modeling
Proven ability to quickly and effectively turn research ML papers into working code
Practical knowledge of how to build efficient end-to-end ML workflows
Hands-on experience on popular ML open source projects such as Spacy, Huggingface Transformers, OpenCV
"Engineer at heart" with a high degree of comfort in designing software systems and producing high-quality code.
Effective verbal and written communication, interpersonal and teamwork skills
What We Offer
A fast paced startup environment with unlimited potential for growth
Unlimited PTO - We believe in work-life balance and want you to take the time you need.
Generous Medical, Dental and Vision packages to choose from
401K and Stock Options
Minimum Qualifications...
Outlined below are the required minimum qualifications for this position. If none are listed, there are no minimum qualifications.
As permitted by applicable law, provide evidence of full vaccination as defined by CDC guidelines OR secure approval of medical or religious accommodation for the vaccination mandate., Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science and 3 years’ experience in software engineering or related field OR 5 years’ experience in software engineering or related field.
Preferred Qualifications...
Outlined below are the optional preferred qualifications for this position. If none are listed, there are no preferred qualifications.
Master’s degree in Computer Science or related field and 2 years' experience in software engineering or related field
Primary Location...
2628 NE UNIVERSITY VILLAGE ST, SEATTLE, WA 98105-5023, United States of America

We are Fresh. Together let’s build the future. With partners and clients, we practice strategy, design, development, and engineering to harness the power of technology and create what’s next.

Our cross-disciplinary approach blends human ingenuity and technology, empowering us to meet uncertainty with confidence. What got us to today won’t get us to tomorrow, so we test our assumptions and always strive for growth. From the products we build to the partners we collaborate with, we believe people make the difference.

And we do so as a workforce representative of the communities we serve, understanding that a diverse workforce strengthens our organization. We value diversity and support a positive and welcoming environment where all of our employees can thrive.

Why join Fresh?
We are tech industry veterans in software, hardware, strategy, and design who are pooling our skills to build the future we want to live in. We are solving real-world problems for people by leveraging robotics, machine learning and computer vision, among other technologies, with an eye toward the end-to-end user experience. Our team is agile, diverse, and driven. We believe that the best way to solve complicated, dynamic problems is collaboratively and respectfully. Most of all, we were built from the start as a modern, high performance services partner that puts people — from our employees to our partners to our clients to their customers, first.

What you’ll be doing?
You will oversee a team of multidisciplinary strategists who deliver consistent, quality insights to Fresh’s portfolio of clients. You will collaborate with other practice area leaders to ensure that strategy is an ever-present part of our design and development process. You will also cultivate interest in strategy across the organization, across current and new clients, and help elevate, mentor, and guide the members of the strategy department across their respective growth paths — from generalist strategy to product and business strategy to design strategy.

You will successfully employ empathetic leadership skills, communicate and collaborate across Practice Areas and within the Strategy and Design department, make strategy accessible to non-practitioners and help individual contributors reach their highest potential. This position will report directly to the Chief Strategy Officer, and be responsible to:

Work alongside Pursuit Teams (multidisciplinary business development teams) to ensure that new business efforts contemplate the appropriate level of strategy resourcing and deliverables
Work with Strategy Leads to oversee and ensure the delivery of strategy work across the portfolio of clients, ensuring consistency, quality, and accuracy of the work product
Lead team resourcing, culture, and development meetings to share department insights, recent successes, and problem solve challenges
Work closely with Design Studio Manager to ensure that the team is properly allocated and help anticipate additional resourcing needs to ensure appropriate time for ramping up contractors or onboarding future colleagues
With input from the Strategy Team, create a plan for the development and distribution of thought leadership, including webinars, blogs, whitepapers, and talks to activate the vision for the department and the team
Review outgoing new business proposals to ensure sufficient level of strategy budget allocated
Work in partnership with Creative Directors to ensure collaboration and alignment regarding strategy direction and designed deliverables
Conduct weekly 1:1s with members of the strategy team and other key contributors to identify growth opportunities for the department
Work with strategy team to establish department vision, mission, mindsets, and a taxonomy of tools & methods
Work closely with Advisory Services team to identify new and emergent business opportunities with key growth clients

We want you to have:

At least 12+ years of strategy experience, with at least 2 years of experience in a director role with direct reports
Minimum 5 years of experience working at a consultancy, agency, or boutique design and strategy studio
Client-facing experience and soft skills to deliver insights to complex problems to client stakeholders, including VPs and the C-Suite
Comfort working with the ambiguity of business challenges and providing clarity for both internal and external stakeholders for how to navigate it
Experience working across a variety of industries, including startups, technology, mid-cap companies, and recognizable brands
Clear, concise communicator with the ability to distill complex insights into simple and actionable directions
Fluency in English

It would be a bonus if you had:

Track record of thought leadership — from white papers to talks to webinars
Adept facilitator and contributor to client strategy deliverables
Experience building strategy practices as part of larger organizations
Interest in cultivating and growing direct reports’ capabilities across a variety of strategy focus areas

We’re big believers in empowering our team to do their best work by offering:

A high integrity, values-driven Executive Leadership Team
Competitive salary and benefits plan
HSA / HRA Options to Medical Plans
Employee Insurance premiums paid by Fresh
Competitive time-off plans
Wellness program
401K with partial matching
Training and development programs
Daily catered lunch
Partnerships with interesting and engaging clients who align with our values
Fun and collaborative work environment with a focus on growth

Equal employment opportunity: All qualified persons will be considered for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, marital status, familial status, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability for which a reasonable accommodation can be made or any other status protected by law. Assistance will be gladly provided upon request for any applicant with sensory or non-sensory disabilities.

The Microsoft Threat Experts Team is looking for an experienced leader to join the threat hunting team! No matter how sophisticated attacker behaviors become, Microsoft 365 Defender will help enterprises detect, investigate, and respond to advanced attacks and data breaches on their networks. Our team uses deep knowledge of the attacker landscape and rich telemetry from our sensors to perform root-cause analysis and generate custom alerts, ensuring that Microsoft 365 Defender customers are well equipped to quickly respond to human adversaries identified in their unique environments.

Ensuring that no human adversary can operate silently begins with experts harnessing the powerful optics provided by Microsoft 365 Defender, across the attacker kill-chain, coupled with world-class detections. We are looking for a leader to help us harness the power of Microsoft’s trillions of security signals to quickly identify and report the latest human adversary behaviors, drive critical context-rich alerts, build new tools and automations in support of hunting objectives, and drive innovations for detecting advanced attacker tradecraft.

ResponsibilitiesLead a team within the Microsoft Threat Experts organization which protects customers directly via managed security service offerings.Work cross-functionally with engineering, marketing, and business leaders to innovate and deliver new security managed services offerings at a global scale.Work directly with senior leaders of our customers’ security organizations as design partners on new innovations, as well as to ensure excellent customer satisfaction with our products and services.Investigate, analyze, and learn from security researchers, attackers, and real incidents to develop durable detection solution/strategies across the kill-chain or product/OS enhancements.Work with other internal and external teams to forge new and improve existing partnerships that help mature the products that support the MTE service offerings.Provide exemplary leadership in an exceptionally challenging and rewarding environment and influence the organization.

Qualifications
Required qualifications:
7+ years of experience in a technical role in the areas of Security Operations, Threat Intelligence, Cyber Incident Response, or Penetration Testing/Red Team.5+ years of people management experience, or relevant experience demonstrating readiness to step up into a people management role.
The following additional experiences are favorable, but not required:
Demonstrated success in building and managing large, diverse, international teamsExperience leading a security function for a customer (i.e.: SOC Director, CISO, Security CTO)Knowledge of operating system internals and attack techniques in Windows, Linux, Mac, Android & iOS platformsKnowledge of kill-chain model, ATT&CK framework, and modern penetration testing techniquesKnowledge of major cloud and productivity platforms as well as identity systems and related security concernsExperienced with curation of Threat Intelligence and delivering customer briefingsStrong ability to use data to 'tell a story'Experience with reverse engineering, digital forensics (DFIR) or incident response, or machine learning modelsExperience with system administration in a large enterprise environment including Windows and Linux servers and workstations, network administration, cloud administrationExperience with offensive security including tools such as Metasploit, exploit development, Open Source Intelligence Gathering (OSINT), and designing ways to breach enterprise networks
Additional advanced technical degrees or cyber security certifications such as CISSP, OSCP, CEH, or GIAC certifications

At Shelf Engine, our mission is to reduce food waste through automation. We harness the power of AI to provide real-time, intelligent forecasting and fully automated ordering to food retailers across the United States. We're able to drastically reduce the amount of food waste generated while simultaneously maximizing sales and expanding margins for grocers—a triple win for suppliers and retailers, consumers, and the environment.
At Shelf Engine, our mission is to reduce waste through automation. We are building an exciting and complex AI system to provide real-time, intelligent forecasting and inventory optimization for groceries, restaurants, and cafeterias across the United States. We're able to drastically reduce the amount of waste which in turn drives profit for retailers, lowers costs for consumers, and reduces negative ecological and social impacts.

We are looking for Data Science Managers to join our growing team. We solve sophisticated supply chain problems using a complex array of machine learning, forecasting, inventory, optimization, and other models. We are growing fast in machine learning R&D, machine learning engineering, and ML Ops. We are looking for a hands-on technical manager to develop best-in-class AI products. If you are a strong technical manager and are interested in making a huge social impact, this could be your dream job.

As a Data Science Manager, you will:

Lead a team to enhance and maintain a production machine learning system at scale
Manage and deliver on high-quality end-to-end solutions in your domain
Work cross-functionally with Engineering and customer-facing teams
Continuously improve the quality and accessibility of our data science capabilities
Provide technical expertise to continuously improve our product
Mentor and provide professional development to direct reports
Embrace our company principles through inclusive, authentically kind, and empathetic interactions

You might make a great Data Science Manager if you have:

A Bachelor's or Master's degree in STEM field
5-7+ + years industry experience with some combination of:
Experience putting models into production or with a live online system
Experience working with big data (e.g. SQL, Spark)
Experience with performance monitoring and automated alerting
Experience with production ML tooling (e.g. Airflow, Databricks, Azure, AWS, or GCP)
2+ years of management experience
Experience leading data scientists and growing teams
An attitude that is collaborative, collegial, and passionate about impact
Eagerness to work at a rapid growth start-up
Authorization to work in the U.S. for any employer

What Shelf Engine offers you:

A unique opportunity to join a fast-growing sustainability startup early on, making a meaningful impact on the team as well as the environment
An inclusive work environment that emphasizes each team member's personal and professional growth
Competitive salary in the range of $150,000 to $200,000
Pre-IPO equity with a four-year vesting schedule
PTO that is unlimited and self-managed for full-time employees
100% employer-paid premiums for medical, dental, and vision insurance for employees, and 50% covered for eligible dependents
Coverage for life insurance, short- and long-term disability, and access to a robust Employee Assistance Program
Optional employee contribution of pre-tax dollars to medical and dependent care FSA accounts
401k plan through Guideline to contribute to your financial future
Seattle only: Company-paid ORCA transit card

About Us:

At Shelf Engine, you will join a team of driven, passionate, and caring people hungry to make change in an untapped industry. We're not only solving complex technical problems at scale but also tackling key initiatives with significant environmental impacts. Our team is determined to disrupt a massive industry and leave behind a positive legacy for generations to come.

Shelf Engine is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

JobTitle: Business Strategy Senior Director, Worldwide Industry Soluti...
Content_text:
The Health and Life Sciences Industry Team, part of the Worldwide Industry Solutions Organization, is seeking a Senior Director of Business Strategy to be based in North America. This role is accountable for leveraging deep industry and technical expertise to empower our customer’s digital transformation, enable sales teams, service line, and partners to deliver relevant industry solutions and services. It’s no longer about one simple software solution; it’s about creating a connected, secure, efficient, and scalable industry ecosystem of integrated products, technologies, and cloud services.
If you have a passion for applying technology to the world’s greatest challenges in life science and want to be part of the digital revolution, we want to hear from you.
This role will also serve as a trusted advisor to Microsoft’s regional business leads, client teams, and service line teams to identify market trends and customer needs and enable new business opportunities through industry solutions. This includes developing thought leadership across Microsoft’s Health and Life Science stakeholders that will accelerate digital transformation, industry competition and solution strategies, strong partnerships, as well as long-term, sustainable growth for Microsoft.
This role holder looks around corners, is deeply innovative and inspirational and can rally the ecosystem internally and externally to establish Microsoft as the leading Cloud platform for Health and Life Science. This leader deeply understands industry challenges, landscape, and where technology can be best applied to accelerate transformation and reduce time to value.
The role is expected to contribute to all levels of the Health and Life Science strategy for Microsoft including analysis of business and technical capabilities as well as development of frameworks and best practices that will scale across Microsoft’s service line and partners.
The ability to hold others accountable and demonstrate impact and influence without direct control while maintaining excellent cross-company collaboration are critical success factors for the role. This role does not own resources in product engineering, service line, region or the field, but given their span of influence, experience and seniority, our regional business leads, the field, partner, business development, and engineering will look to this leader for collaboration and insights on the strategy and solutions for our Health and Life Science customers and partners.
Our team culture is centered on embracing a growth mindset, inspiring excellence, and encouraging teams and leaders to bring their best each day. We also put great value on transparency, creativity, and a well-developed sense of humor to ensure we have fun while maintaining curiosity and respect for each other and the customers, partners, and individuals we serve.
Responsibilities
As the Senior Director of Business Strategy, you will be a business strategy owner of Microsoft’s Health and Life Sciences (HLS) business and a customer and partner advocate across the organization. This role is focused on defining Microsoft’s commercial industry strategy, to include researching and identifying priority industry solutions that best unlock Microsoft's technical capabilities in market and working closely with Microsoft’s service line, engineering teams, and industry partners to achieve market scale. The role delivers growth of Microsoft Industry cloud services—as well as other advanced technologies including AI, cognitive services, mixed reality, robotics, digital twins, and others—by developing the partner ecosystem and enabling industry solutions that solve the customers business challenges as they digitally transform their businesses.

Strategy Development & Evolution:
Combine your deep knowledge of the Health and Life Sciences industry with Microsoft platform expertise to create a multi-year strategy, in partnership with Engineering, Product Marketing, Regional Business Leads, Services, Partner teams and other Microsoft teams, inclusive of product roadmap, partner plans, business development and acquisition. This business plan will contemplate how to grow Microsoft’s share across Health and Life Sciences with a focus on the adoption and consumption of Microsoft Industry Priority Solutions.

Deliver thought leadership globally:
Represent Microsoft at key industry events, Microsoft external events such as Microsoft Envision, and at the Executive Briefing Center. Author blogs, white papers, etc. leverage social media and networks to promote MSFT’s leadership in the industry.

Lead Change Management Efforts:
Partner with Health and Life Sciences team leaders and the broader Enterprise Commercial leadership team to define and drive internal change management efforts, including prioritizing and implementing new solutions, collaboratively establishing strategy, driving sales and partner ecosystem scale, and engaging with other key leaders to deeply embed industry plans to land the business value of Microsoft priorities and technology portfolio at executive client touch points, strengthening Microsoft’s role as a trusted advisor in Life Sciences.

Closed Feedback Loop:
Facilitation and delivery of closed feedback loop with key executive sponsors and cross-organizational partners including Customers, Engineering, Product Marketing, Regional Business Leads, WW Specialist Sales/Customer Success, Inside Sales, One Commercial partner (OCP), Commercial Software Engineering, the Digital Advisor team and Microsoft Service Line leaders to ensure constant evolution of the strategy and offerings.

Control and Monitor Results:
Analyze market share gains, sales outcomes, customer feedback, and other key metrics to assess health and progress of the Health and Life Sciences strategy and its ability to drive sustainable revenue and consumption growth.
Qualifications
Required Qualifications:
10+ years of experience in a combination management/strategy consulting, technology & marketing roles within the Health and Life Sciences and related fields.
Preferred Qualifications:
The successful candidate will be an experienced strategist and business leader with a proven track record of developing strategy from the ground up along with exceptional customer/partner relationship management, customer technology adoption plans, assessment/development and delivery execution. The role will develop recommendations on how to accelerate our Life Science strategy, including analysis of build, partner and buy opportunities and other strategic investment proposals that will inspire senior leaders to invest in the strategy.
Established Health and Life Sciences experience, expertise, and credentials with customer line-of-business needs and deep industry solution technical expertise.
Knowledge of the Microsoft Enterprise Platform, or at least of all disruptive technologies such as artificial intelligence, machine learning, mixed reality, etc. and the ability to map relevant technologies to customers’ IT and business needs and priorities.
In-depth understanding of the partner ecosystems (including Tier 1s, ISVs, SIs) related to Health and Life Science and the ability to identify leading solution vendors or systems integrators with relevant repeatable solutions or domain practices.
Deep understanding of the industry competitive landscape and be able to translate Microsoft’s value proposition to drive global compete strategies.
Understand, and have experience with the application of cloud-based technologies in a Life Science environment.
Proven ability to work across engineering, sales, and marketing teams.
Proven capabilities of exemplary impact through cross-group collaboration and partnerships.
Relentless drive to get things done.
Outstanding written and verbal communications skills.
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, similar information technology-related, or engineering and/or science discipline degree a plus but hands on experience and demonstrated success in industry preferred.
Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. JobTitle: newProfessional Services Regional Practice Architect, Security
Content_text:
Join us as we pursue our disruptive new vision to make machine data accessible, usable and valuable to everyone. We are a company filled with people who are passionate about our product and seek to deliver the best experience for our customers. At Splunk, we’re committed to our work, customers, having fun and most importantly to each other’s success. Learn more about Splunk careers and how you can become a part of our journey!
Splunk is the world’s first Data-to-Everything Platform. Now organizations no longer need to worry about where their data is coming from, and they are free to focus on the business outcomes that data can deliver.
Role:
As a Global Services Regional Practice Architect, you will ensure enterprise deployments make the deepest impact possible for our customers. You'll tackle an organizations’ most challenging problems, including the ones they didn't know existed. Regional Practice Architects are adept at mastering new technologies and come from a variety of business, analytics and technology backgrounds. They are eager to share their knowledge with others through formal and informal mentoring activities. Of paramount importance is the ability to be a great teammate and work well with others towards common goals.
Responsibilities:
Deliver compelling messaging articulating Splunk’s value proposition to executive leadership in current and prospective Splunk customer accounts.
Defend the necessity of a Splunk Security investment to customer VP and CxO leadership based upon risk, allocation of resources, tools/people spend, and proprietary vs open-source approaches.
Provide collaborative communications and customer partnership that allows customers to feel valued, heard and supported.
Assess customer security programs to include operational and Governance, Risk and Compliance capabilities to measure threat detection/analysis, mitigation, remediation and recovery capabilities.
Advise customers on industry best practices regarding the use of threat intelligence, event investigations, incident management and investigations, vulnerability management, asset management, and preventive security controls.
Advise on the incorporation of Threat Intelligence, Machine Learning, SOAR, and Behavioral Analytics technologies for successful customer outcomes.
Perform just-in-time knowledge acquisition in order to deliver training to customer and partner teams and end users on advancing technologies.
Mentor and coach junior Splunk and partner consultants in new knowledge and process areas, in security methodology, technology, consultancy, in non-technical areas.
Build relevant materials for field teams highlighting new product features, industry trends, and other deep technical content.
Interact with customers and prospects to understand their business challenges and desired outcomes.
Partner with field leadership to jointly develop strategic and technical account plans.
Represent the Global Security Practice to understand current and future product developments, to communicate to the field, as well as contribute to future development direction based upon customer needs and your security expertise.
Support Global Security Practice initiatives, such as service offerings development and support product interlock.
In partnership with your manager, develop and supervise appropriate performance goals and metrics.
Deliver presentations and technical briefings to customers on Splunk premium products and solutions. Assist and lead with critical Splunk evaluations and POC’s.
Deliver on paid customer subscriptions (Assigned Expert, On-Demand Services, etc).
Acquire and maintain senior level Splunk Security certifications.
Requirements:
5+ years of experience in technically delivering and supporting security software products to a range of customers
Several years experience working as a security analyst, security engineer, security researcher, or other hands-on security role
Development proficiency in at least 1 of the following programming languages: Java, .NET, PHP, Ruby, Python, Node.JS, Objective-C, Java-Dalvik
Working experience with Unix or Linux based scripting languages (Perl, Python, Bash)
Recent experience working with Terraform, Kubernetes or Docker.
Experience working with microservices in cloud environments such as Amazon Web Services (AWS), Google Cloud Platform (GCP), Microsoft Azure.
Experience delivering executive and customer presentations
Several years of experience with *nix, macOS, Windows administration
History of working in a team or project leadership role
Demonstrated communication skills – written and oral. Ability to communicate complex ideas and a clear and concise way
Conference/meetup presentations
Security Blog contributions
Training content development
Knowledge of compliance and risk management requirements from government, financial, and/or health care customers and how requirements impact system design, services capabilities, and what drives customers decisions
Demonstrated experience deploying Splunk technology to customer environments
Unix/Linux and Windows administration, patching and configuration expertise
Experience with networking, server, application, virtualization, big data, and web technologies
Ability to work with diverse groups of people; challenge and lead people toward their peak performance
Expertise with security operations or compliance
Experience with the Splunk Security product portfolio
Experience with US Federal programs and compliance requirements to include the NIST RMF and the ATO process
Able to travel up to 75%
We value diversity at our company. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or any other applicable legally protected characteristics in the location in which the candidate is applying.
For job positions in San Francisco, CA, and other locations where required, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.
(Colorado only*) Minimum base salary of $135,000. You may also be eligible for incentive pay + equity + benefits.*Note: Disclosure per sb19-085 (8-5-201 et seq).

The Marketing Science Research, Creative Shop team is a quantitative research group focused on measuring the value and effectiveness of creative in advertising. The team designs and conducts research studies and leverages and develops new data sources to understand how people respond to creative content on digital platforms. The results are used to guide internal teams and are published as guidance and thought-leadership for the global advertising industry. This team helps develop world-class marketing strategies for both the world's largest advertisers and the millions of small businesses that use our platforms. In this role, you will pair your analytical skills with Facebook’s unique data set to understand the role of creative in advertising. We seek an expert in data science, research methods, and developing working systems to support research. The ideal candidate will have a strong knowledge of statistical methods and machine learning, is focused on results, is self-motivated, and has a history of solving problems with data-driven solutions. You will work closely with our global Creative Strategists to inform scalable strategies for creative development that achieve our clients’ business objectives. You will partner with teams in all major global markets, working to develop region-specific understanding when required. You’re a doer, who loves to ship ideas that will impact businesses of all shapes and sizes on Facebook, Instagram, Messenger, and WhatsApp.


Apply expertise in quantitative analysis, data mining, and the presentation of data to measure and communicate effective strategies for online advertising and brand communications.
Design and execute custom research and leverage modelling techniques to understand the content and impact of creative (including visual, linguistic, and conceptual elements) on digital platforms.
Architect, implement, and deploy new data models and data processes in production, leveraging common development toolkits.
Partner with other data science and research teams to identify new modelling approaches to enhance the identification of creative features within digital content.
Partner with cross-functional teams including Creative Shop, Marketing, Product, Engineering, and Sales to develop solutions that make your work scalable.
Package data-driven research effectively for both technical and non-technical audiences.


Bachelor's degree in Economics, Statistics, Computer Science, Behavioral Science, Applied Mathematics, Operations Research, Engineering, or similar quantitative field.
4+ years of experience in quantitative research or data science.
4+ years experience in designing analytical models and mining structured and unstructured datasets.
Fluency with languages for data manipulation (SQL) and statistical analysis (e.g. Python).
Experience implementing research design methods and applied statistics including sampling approaches, experiments, causal modeling, and data mining techniques.
Knowledge and applied experience with architecting and scaling analytical models, machine learning solutions and mining large datasets.
Experience with distributed computing tools (Map/Reduce, Hadoop, Hive, etc.).
Experience communicating technical ideas to a variety of technical and non-technical audiences.


Experience in the market research or advertising industries.
Experience working with product teams to build scalable, research-driven product solutions.


Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to share what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Together, we can help people build stronger communities - we're just getting started.

The Opportunity

Flexport is looking for a creative, technically-minded senior data engineer motivated to solve some of the world's most challenging data problems in global trade. Data is at the heart of our business, and as a Senior Data Engineer, you will work in complex data warehouse environments supporting global trade. You will partner with Data Science and Software Engineering teams to develop scalable and innovative analytical solutions, process and store large amounts of low latency structured and unstructured data, and enable the Data Science and Machine Learning team to execute successful, data-driven strategies.


You will be responsible for:

designing and implementing a data management and analytical environment using custom and open source tools
developing Python or JVM-centric (Java, Kotlin) solutions to automate ETL, analytics, and data platform management
designing and implementing complex data models, modeling metadata, building reports and dashboards and creating reporting tools for data science and ML products users.
writing highly tuned, scalable SQL queries running over large-scale, heterogeneous data warehouses
designing and deploying data infrastructure needed to drive data-driven decision-making solutions supporting Flexport's marketplace and freight forwarding initiatives.


You should have deep expertise in designing, building, and managing large datasets across various data platforms. You should also excel at working with various customers/partners to understand data needs and implement scalable and efficient ETL solutions. Our data science, product, and engineering teams collaborate very closely with our data engineering team to share domain knowledge, test hypotheses at scale, and develop promising solutions that can be quickly and widely deployed. In addition, we are passionate about providing effortlessly accessible intelligence and actionable insights to our end users. Thus, the ideal data engineering candidate is: self-motivated, highly analytical, technically excellent at writing code, and passionate about delivering cutting-edge data solutions.


Locations: San Francisco, Bellevue


You Will:

Design, implement and improve Data Science's pricing, planning, and ML platforms.
Develop and improve the current data architecture, focusing on improving data security, data quality, latency, scalability, and extensibility.
Leverage state-of-the-art technologies to design, pilot, and deploy low latency data architectures supporting pricing, planning, and various ML/AI initiatives.
Collaborate closely with data scientists, data analytics, product, engineering, and business/operations teams to:
develop, implement, and validate key performance metrics
perform statistical analyses and data profiling, and
support production deployment of low-latency machine learning and optimization solutions.
Partner with Data Scientists, Data Analytics, and business/operations partners to design and deploy experiments and measure the impact of policy and system changes.

You Should Have:
Minimum Qualifications
Bachelor's degree in a quantitative field, such as computer science, machine learning, or a related field with 5+ years of industry experience.
Extensive experience and expertise writing and optimizing complex SQL.
Expert knowledge of data warehousing concepts.
Extensive experience in data mining, profiling, and analysis.
Extensive experience with data modeling, ETL design, and the use of large-scale databases in business environments.
Experience programming with languages such as Python, Ruby, Java.
Experience working with large data sets and knowledge of tools for big data analytics and manipulation (e.g., dbt).
Proven ability and experience to design, develop and deploy innovative data solutions and complex production systems (e.g., supporting pricing, planning, predictions, etc.)
Knowledge of engineering and operational excellence using standard methodologies.

Preferred Qualifications
Deep experience and expertise in ETL optimization, designing, coding, and tuning big data processes using dbt or cloud-native solutions (running on kubernetes (k8s))
Extensive experience designing, developing, and deploying data pipelines and applications to stream and process data at low latencies needed to support near real-time production pricing, planning, and ML solutions.
Demonstrate efficacy in building data solutions that support data lineage tracking, ensuring that data, as it flows from sources to consumptions, can be understood, recorded, and visualized.
Knowledge of distributed systems and data architecture and experience in designing and implementing batch and stream data processing pipelines
Knowledge and experience with optimization of the distribution, partitioning, and parallel processing of high-level data structures.

#LI-RP2


About Flexport

We believe global trade can move the human race forward. That's why it's our mission to make global trade easier for everyone. We aim to do this by building the Operating System for Global trade - a strategic model combining advanced technology and data analytics, logistics infrastructure, and supply chain expertise. Flexport today connects almost 10,000 clients and suppliers across 109 countries, including established global brands like Georgia-Pacific, as well as emerging innovators like Sonos. Started in 2013, we've raised over $1.3B in funding from SoftBank Vision Fund, Founders Fund, GV, First Round Capital, and Y Combinator. We're excited about the three big ways we're moving forward after our recent $1B investment from SoftBank Vision Fund in February 2019.

Are you worried about not having any freight forwarding experience?
Don't be! We're building the first Operating System for Global Trade. That's why it's crucial for us to bring people from diverse backgrounds and experiences together with our industry veterans to help move the freight forwarding industry forward.
What's freight forwarding, and why does it matter? Freight forwarding is the coordination and shipment of goods from one place to another, and it's what makes global trade possible. Flexport is on a mission to make global trade easier for everyone because we believe it can help connect the world and break down economic barriers.
We know this industry is complex. That's why we invest in education starting day one with Flexport Academy, a one-week intensive onboarding program explicitly designed to set every new Flexport employee up for success.

At Flexport, our ability to fulfill our mission of making global trade easy for everyone relies on having a diverse, dedicated, and engaged workforce. That is why Flexport is committed to creating and nurturing an environment where anyone can be their authentic self. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment regardless of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, physical and mental disability, health status, marital and family status, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, military and veteran status, and any other characteristic protected by applicable law.

Facebook Reality Labs Research (FRL-R) brings together a world-class R&D team of researchers, developers, and engineers to build the future of connection within virtual and augmented reality. We're developing all the technologies needed to enable breakthrough AR glasses.

The technology that is being developed within the Surreal team at FRL-R is a new generation of end-to-end real-time 3D scene understanding systems working across novel mobile sensor design, sensor fusion, state estimation, computer vision, large-scale reconstruction and localization, as well as large-scale machine learning, online inference and optimization.

The Surreal team is seeking an experienced Applied Research Manager to lead and support a group of world-class researchers in order to work on a new research initiative as part of the LiveMaps project.


Lead and support a team of applied research scientists to conduct cutting edge research in computer vision and machine learning.
Developing deep neural network models for real-time scene understanding and object tracking.
Partner with Research Program Management in developing a research/incubation/productization roadmap and strategy.
Be both a technical leader and people manager.
Communicate cross-functionally and drive research efforts.
Partner closely with many Facebook internal partner teams to create shared roadmaps and deliver on the product vision.
Communicate with the leadership.


5+ years of people management experience in multi-disciplinary global teams at the intersection of tech and product, including building performing teams and organization.
10+ years of R&D work experience, including 5+ years experience of hands-on technical leadership.
PhD degree in computer vision, machine learning, robotics or related field.
Hands-on experience with machine learning and deep learning tools (e.g. PyTorch, NumPy).
Experience in 3D scene understanding, 3D object reconstruction and tracking.
Demonstrated experience in recruiting and managing technical teams, including performance management.
Leadership and interpersonal communication experience in working across many disciplines, driving best practices, and mentor team members.


Experience leading a team to ship advanced machine learning/computer vision features into consumer electronic products.
Proven track record of achieving significant results as demonstrated by grants, or fellowships, as well as first-authored publications in top conferences at leading conferences (e.g., NIPS, ICLR, ICML, SIGGRAPH, CVPR, ECCV and ICCV) or journals (e.g., PAMI, IJCV, JMLR, ToG).
Experience managing joint hardware-software development and associated rapid prototyping projects.

JobTitle: Sr. Data Engineer, Prime Video Computer Vision & Machine Lea...
Content_text:
5+ years of experience as a Data Engineer or in a similar role
Experience with data modeling, data warehousing, and building ETL pipelines
Experience in SQL

Job summary
The Prime Video team is shaping the future of digital video entertainment and we are looking for entrepreneurial individuals to join us in innovating the viewing experience. We are a team focused on creating advanced AI solutions utilizing computer vision (CV) and machine learning (ML) technologies to invent exciting new customer experiences.

Key job responsibilities
Design and deliver big data architectures for experimental and production consumption between scientists and software engineering

Develop the end-to-end automation of data pipelines, making datasets readily-consumable by visualization tools and notification systems

Create automated alarming and dashboards to monitor data integrity

Create and manage capacity and performance plans.
Act as the subject matter expert for the data structure and usage

A day in the life
In this role, you will be at the center of the CV/ML transformation, joining our team in its Day 1 mission to drive industry resolution and develop technology solutions from scratch. As a Sr. Data Engineer, you will work closely with research scientists and engineers to develop solutions that have never been developed before, and also drive customer value while having fun. This includes developing and managing the data flow of information from ML output, through to personalization algorithms, data warehouses, and finally to the customer CX.


Passion for Entertainment
Masters or Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Math, Finance, Statistics or a related discipline
Experience with Amazon Redshift
Experience in scripting languages
Experience working with business owners to define key business requirements and convert to technical specification
Experience handling Big data volumes and performance tuning
Familiarity with solutions such as AWS, EC2, S3, or DynamoDB
Experience working in a UNIX/LINUX environment
Strong analytical and problem solving skills
Excellent verbal and written communication skills

At KenSci, we obsess over a very simple problem – How can we make healthcare better using data. We are a diverse group of Data Scientists, Doctors, Engineers and Customer focused individuals on a path to building an important and meaningful technology company. With explainable AI models for healthcare, KenSci is making risk-based prediction more efficient, accountable, and cost effective. Our team is constantly working to solve complex problems and have created a risk prediction platform that helps health systems identify population risk and optimize clinical outcomes and operational efficiency across the care continuum.

Here at KenSci we have a “Come as you are” mentality. Although we are proud to call Seattle home, we have smart, fun, creative people stretched across the globe. KenSci believes our people are our best asset. That’s why our benefits are amazing, and our work life balance is unheard of! We lead with empathy, get things done quickly and work as a family.


KenSci is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or other medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics.


Role

We are looking for a Senior Software Engineer to join the Experiences Team at KenSci. The ideal candidate is eager to work within and across disciplines to understand requirements, design, and implement the user experiences of our Machine Learning Platform.
KenSci is on a mission to transform healthcare with data-driven insights. Each day, KenSci Data Scientists solve challenging, life-saving problems using machine learning (ML) to impact the entire continuum of care for patients across the globe. KenSci is a spin-out from several years of healthcare ML research at the University of Washington, with investments from Ignition Partners, Polaris Partners, Osage Ventures, Mindset Ventures and UL Ventures. KenSci is the world’s first cloud based vertically integrated healthcare analytics platform.

We are looking for a team player who will demonstrate ownership, deliver results, and work collaboratively with Software Engineers, UX Designers, Data Scientists, and Product Managers.
Your Impact

Your work will help our customers save lives: We collaborate deeply with our customers to bring the promise of predictive analytics, AI and ML to clinical and operational intervention. Our platform has the capacity to save lives by predicting health risks, disease progression and clinical outcomes.
You will accelerate innovation in healthcare: We work with technology innovators across the ecosystem. AI in healthcare is in its early days and we seek out ambitious partners and customers who are willing to commit to the journey. Through your work, you will help solve real world problems working alongside various experts focused on improving patient care.
You are essential to building a great team and company: As an early employee of KenSci, you will help shape the culture, values, and mission. We want your partnership in building an enduring company, defined by social impact.


Your Core Responsibilities

Design and develop key components that power the User Experiences of our ML platform
Demonstrate a strong sense of ownership for the product and mission
Deliver on individual goals against timelines
Support other members of the team as needed to help towards team goals
Collaborate and connect with other disciplines within KenSci to help shape a culture of trust and transparency


Requirements

You are a meticulous and curious engineer with a proven track record of delivering innovative product and platform solutions. You have the following attributes:

4+ years of developer experience
Experience with and desire to work with web technologies across the stack
Expertise with Typescript, NodeJS, and ReactJS
Expertise with deploying and managing production software
Expertise with web-based authentication and security best practices
Experience working with databases (SQL, Object Storage)
Experiences with cloud technologies (Azure)
Excellent written and verbal communication skills


KenSci is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or other medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics.

Facebook AI’s mission is to advance the state-of-the-art in artificial intelligence through fundamental and applied research in open collaboration with the community. Our work covers the full spectrum of topics related to AI, including deriving knowledge from data: Theory, algorithms, applications, software infrastructure and hardware infrastructure. We actively engage with the community through publications, open source software, participation in technical conferences and workshops, and collaborations with academia.We are looking for a Program Manager to build and scale global programs to strengthen the impact of our engineering and research teams. We drive efficiency, cultivate relationships, increase knowledge sharing, and facilitate meaningful external collaborations and partnerships. In this role, you will define, establish, and maintain project-specific and org-wide programs as well as create, manage, and scale processes to build capacity and support the growing organization.The ideal candidate is entrepreneurial, comfortable navigating ambiguous situations, anticipating project issues and resolving them, connecting resources and removing barriers. This role requires project and program management experience and broad knowledge of research's impact on product design and development. Communication skills, stakeholder management, experience managing complex logistics, and an organized approach are mandatory.


Define and manage strategic initiatives that improve team efficiency and impact, establishing operational systems and outcomes
Proactively identify and partner with stakeholders on internal processes, templates, and guidelines to improve team optimization and documentation
Proactively manage expectations: Define clear program roadmaps, provide frequent program updates, identify and communicate risks and adjustments, and ensure commitments are delivered
Manage relationships with cross-functional partners, such as Design, Legal, and Policy


Bachelor's degree
4+ years experience as a program or project manager, or similar role
4+ years of experience establishing and growing end-to-end, cross-functional programs


Experience working with technical teams, especially in machine learning or artificial intelligence
Experience building relationships with peers and senior stakeholders and collaborating with cross-functional teams across multiple locations
Experience communicating with data to drive change
Track record of operating independently and taking initiative, embracing ambiguity, demonstrating creativity, being detail-oriented, and delivering results in a highly organized manner
Experience in a dynamic, fast-paced environment that requires independent time management, task prioritization, flexibility, and keen experience to identify problems and proactively work towards solutions
