JobTitle: Senior Software Engineer - Technical Lead, Automated Insight...
Content_text:
To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.
Job Category
Products and Technology
Job Details
What you will be doing:
We are looking for a strong software engineer, who is passionate about Machine Learning and leveraging data and algorithms for achieving a delightful and frictionless user experience when interacting with, visualizing and analyzing data. Our team advances the state-of-the-art in the Analytics space and helps deliver on our company’s mission to help people see and understand their data. You will be working on a team of highly skilled and motivated engineers, building the next generation of delightful user experiences that leverage the power of Machine Learning.
You will work on Tableau’s next-generation Visual Analytics and Collaboration suite. As a full stack developer you will be working on a Python and Java based backend platform with modern web technologies frontend. You will do this and more in a highly collaborative environment full of talented professionals who are dedicated to helping people "see and understand their data".
Some of the things you’ll be doing include:
- Build modern front-end consumer-friendly interfaces and their Java and Python backend services allowing people to answer complex questions about their data.
- Craft novel experiences for interactions with automated Machine Learning services to make a delightful experience when answering questions and telling stories with data.
Who you are:
- Solid development skills with Python and Java. Experience developing in web languages such as JavaScript, TypeScript, HTML/CSS. C++ skills are a plus.
- Fast learner who will help us establish scalable, efficient, automated processes for large scale data analyses, model development, validation and implementation.
- Learning is Breathing. You believe that you and the company are on a rapid growth path, and that your career and your customers demand that you keep adding new skills.
- Highly Technical. You love writing things that “just work” – things that are robust, scalable, and that perform well. You have a strong understanding of software architectures relevant to multi-tier client applications.
- A True Team Player. You enjoy collaborating, learning from or teaching others so we can all become better developers. You assume good intent in others, and actively do your part to make a positive work environment.
- Self-Motivated. You do good work, and lots of it, and not because your boss is watching… the drive to deliver is just a part of you.
- You are a Recruiter! Tableau hires company builders and, in this role, you will be asked to be on the constant lookout for the best talent to bring onboard to help us continue to build one of the best companies in the world!
Accommodations
If you require assistance due to a disability applying for open positions please submit a request via this Accommodations Request Form .
Posting Statement
At Salesforce we believe that the business of business is to improve the state of our world. Each of us has a responsibility to drive Equality in our communities and workplaces. We are committed to creating a workforce that reflects society through inclusive programs and initiatives such as equal pay, employee resource groups, inclusive benefits, and more. Learn more about Equality at Salesforce and explore our benefits.
Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org are Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employers. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org do not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org will not pay any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with Salesforce.com or Salesforce.org .
Salesforce welcomes all.

Role Purpose:
At Jumio, you will work for the market leader in online identity verification that is helping to make the digital world a safer place for everyone. As a Senior Product Manager, you will own the roadmap for Jumio’s user onboarding platform. You will closely work with the customers, partners, business development, legal and engineering teams to identify the risk and fraud capabilities on the platform to enable end to end orchestration of our customer’s end user journey and help expand the state of the art in this exciting domain.
Role Value:
The KYX Platform Senior PM is responsible for building an essential component of a unified platform that adapts to the unique needs and risks of organizations. The Jumio KYX Platform lets modern enterprises easily verify user identities for onboarding, safeguard existing accounts and mitigate financial crime risk. You’ll own an important strategic piece of the Jumio KYX Platform strategy.
Responsibilities:
Engage with internal and external stakeholders to define product roadmap and functional requirements
Provide vision and direction to the cross-functional development team and stakeholders
Closely collaborate with engineering and product design teams to integrate new risk, fraud and AML checks
Create and maintain a product backlog according to business case and company strategy
Translate business requirements and product initiatives into epics and user stories.
Ensure that agile teams have a clear understanding of what they are developing and why (business case)
Monitor product development progress on an ongoing basis
Work closely with the user experience team to deliver world class experience to Jumio customers
Closely follow the industry trends and best practices to refine product direction as necessary
Effectively communicate product updates with the stakeholders all over the globe
Experience and Qualifications:
8+ years professional experience that includes 2 or more years as a Product Manager/Product Owner in an agile environment
Solid understanding of the risk, fraud and AML checks for the user onboarding use cases
High level understanding of machine learning concepts
Knowledge of agile processes and principles
Great attention to detail
Exceptional analytical, conceptual and spoken/written communication skills
Ability to travel domestically and internationally for business
Great to have Experience and Qualifications:
Expertise in KYC/AML, Identity Verification and Fraud Prevention
Prior experience with established vendors in the above domains
Example Objectives:
Contribution in creating requirements documents for new products / features
Take responsibility for the organizational rollout of a new feature or product by working closely with Sales, Marketing and Support to create the necessary internal and external training material
Key Characteristics and Attitudes:
In a recent global survey these attributes were valued by Jumios in all locations and functions - we firmly believe in hiring for attitude as well as skill.
Friendly and supportive
Adaptable and flexible
Articulate and persuasive
High IQ and EQ
Curious and coachable
Commercially Aware
Resilient and tenacious
Big picture and the detail
Jumio Values:
IDEAL: Integrity, Diversity, Empowerment, Accountability, Leading Innovation
Company:
Jumio is the future for online and mobile ID verification. We are the largest and fastest growing company in the ID verification space. With a global footprint, we’re expanding the team to meet strong client demand across a range of industries including Financial Services, Travel, Sharing Economy, Fintech, Gaming, and others.
Equal Opportunities:
Jumio is a collaboration of people with different ideas, strengths, interests and cultures. We welcome applications and colleagues from all backgrounds and statuses.

Have you ever rented an apartment and wished the process could be better? At Funnel we do too. We know we need to make the process of renting an apartment as easy as purchasing socks on Amazon. We’ve created cloud-based marketing and leasing software that delivers the ultimate rental experience for everyone involved in the process. We’re in the process of transforming the real estate industry through cutting-edge technology built, sold, and supported by the most passionate people you’ll meet.
We’re searching for a software engineer who is excited to use cutting edge technology to develop our product. We hope this individual is excited about working on a modern technology stack in an agile environment producing great products.
This is a fully remote role though if you are in the Tampa, Florida or New York City area, you’d have the option to come into our local office.
What you’ll do:
Work on a pod with other engineers partnered with a product owner and designer in a dynamic, agile environment innovating on new products and features.
Shepherd new product features from conception through implementation and client feedback.
Drive the development of internal and external APIs.
Develop backend services to support product and data management.
Constantly improve our development practices and architecture.
Provide feedback and mentorship to other engineers on the team.
Qualifications:
3+ years of professional experience
Proficiency with one or more modern web application frameworks, like Django, Flask, Rails, etc.
Experience designing schemas and optimizing queries in a relational database.
Comfortable with the fundamentals of front-end development (HTML, CSS, JS) and one or more front-end frameworks (React, Backbone, Angular)
Care about UX/Design and love talking product.
Have a track record of motivating, and contributing to productive engineering teams.
Have a background as strong individual contributor to development projects.
Advocate of pragmatic testing, continuous integration and continuous delivery.
Bonus Points:
Experience working in real estate
Machine learning experience

RStudio creates great software that helps people understand data and make better decisions in real-world applications. Our core offering is an open source data science toolchain, and we aim to make it available to everyone, regardless of their economic means.

We’re a fast-growing company with the goal of making a lasting and meaningful contribution to the world. Our mission is to provide the most widely used open-source software and enterprise-ready professional products for statistical data analysis, package management, and sharing of data products at scale. Our tools further the cause of equipping everyone, regardless of economic means, to participate in a global economy that increasingly rewards data literacy.

RStudio is seeking an experienced Product Manager to manage our MLOps product and service offerings. RStudio provides development environments for R and Python, professional solutions for publishing, sharing and deployments of applications, markdown reports, notebooks, models, and APIs.

The Product Manager MLOps will be responsible for all aspects of a product line management function at RStudio, reporting to the Head of Product. Product Managers at RStudio are working closely with the product development teams and customer-facing teams to encourage cross-team knowledge, customer, and domain sharing.

This role requires a technical product manager with expertise in deploying, monitoring, and managing machine learning models at scale. This role could also fit product-minded DevOps/ML Engineers with a background in model lifecycle management and deployment.

What you’ll be doing:

Establish and define the product vision, value propositions, and product strategy for RStudio’s MLOps offerings.
Gather inputs and insights from market and business environments, existing and potential customers, internal stakeholders, competitors and our partner network.
Identify target customers and user types.
Work with stakeholders on business objectives and define responsible and meaningful outcome-driven roadmaps that are more than just a list of features and dates.
Establish product metrics to track product performance, health, and progress against the strategy.
Leverage user stories and user journey maps to unpackage customer needs into actionable themes and tasks.
Understand and define infrastructure solutions and detailed feature-level deliverables for each development stage of the product.
Prioritize feature development leveraging clearly defined criteria like desirability, feasibility and viability.
Communicate key product development stages with stakeholders.
Work closely with product marketing, marketing, solutions engineering, sales and other teams to successfully bring the product to market.

About you:

5+ years of experience and a demonstrated track record in technical product management for data/ml products and/or infrastructure/ml engineering.
Deep understanding of development, testing, deploying, monitoring, and operationalizing machine learning models.
Understanding of ci/cd pipelines for large-scale production deployments.
Knowledge of data/model lifecycle management and data/model governance.
Knowledge of Python, YAML, and task automation tools like PowerShell.
Experience with DevOps tools like GitHub, Ansible and/or Jenkins and container technologies like Docker.
Experience with cluster orchestration tools like Kubernetes.
Certifications on AWS, Azure, and/or GCP are desirable.

About us:

We welcome all talented colleagues and are committed to a culture that represents diversity in all its forms.
We prioritize giving ourselves “focus time” to get deep work done. We minimize meetings and attempt to operate asynchronously.
We are a learning organization and take mentorship and career growth seriously. We hope to learn from you and we anticipate that you will also deepen your skills, influence, and leadership as a result of working at RStudio.
We operate under a unique sustainable business model: We have over 50% of our engineering dedicated to creating free and open source software. We are profitable and we plan to be around decades from now.

Notable:

100% distributed team (or come in to one of our offices in Seattle or Boston) with minimal travel
Competitive compensation with great benefits including:
medical/dental/vision insurance (100% of premiums covered)
401k matching
a home office allowance or reimbursement for a coworking space
a profit-sharing system
Flexible environment with a generous vacation policy

#LI-Remote

At Boeing, we innovate and collaborate to make the world a better place. From the seabed to outer space, you can contribute to work that matters with a company where diversity, equity and inclusion are shared values. We’re committed to fostering an environment for every teammate that’s welcoming, respectful and inclusive, with great opportunity for professional growth. Find your future with us.
Boeing Data Solutions Service provides multiple products and offerings that allow application teams to have the flexibility and agility to meet their specific application development and security requirements, by securing and enabling business data. The team is currently looking for one Senior Data Architect to join their team.
Boeing is transforming its business and adopting a data centric culture. Boeing is modernizing its suite of applications. This position will drive the transformation by collaborating and working closely with engineering, manufacturing, data science functions and gather requirements from business leaders. Data Architect will be building solutions that include data modeling, technology selection, solution design, process design, and execution. The said position will also have the opportunity to collaborate with other common service functions, interact with the most innovative and diverse people around the globe.
Position Responsibilities:
Drive strategic roadmaps, capabilities development and maturation aligned to data products industry standard taxonomy including an emphasis on future state modern cloud native solutions.
Perform data architecture, data migration, data modeling, data access, data integration, data cataloging, data governance and implementation techniques.
Understand and provide solutions to the integration team for data migration, APIs and Microservices.
Understand various data models across different Boeing functions (Engineering, Manufacturing, Defense, Commercial and Global Services) to drive patterns and playbooks for automation to manage “data as a product”.
Work with larger product management community to identify gaps and provide solutions, and influence the Program Increment planning for Platform Services for data products and features.
Design and participate in defining end-solutions that will evolve with future business needs and satisfy diverse set of requirements including ETL/ELT, OLTP, OLAP, searches, pattern matching, data mining and data warehouse.
Work very closely with product managers, Database Administrators and business data architects to define technical product requirements and collaborate within agile team to drive user story/tasks creation along with design and development activities.
Automation using DevOps/DevSecOps, apply machine learning algorithms and artificial intelligence and other available tools to expedite the product development along with First Time Quality.
Participate in group sessions within developer community and share knowledge.
Mentors team members and contribute in creating and maintaining best coding practices and oversight using stringent reviews.
Effectively resolve problems and roadblocks as they occur, consistently following through details while driving innovation as well as issue resolution.
Monitor the implementation of architecture throughout the system development lifecycle and seek and provide clarification when needed.
Work with cross-functional teams spread across multiple products and locations within Boeing and external partners, across different cultures and time-zones.
This position allows telecommuting. The selected candidate will be required to perform some work onsite at one of the listed location options.
The position must meet Export Control compliance requirements, therefore a “US Person” as defined by 22 C.F.R. § 120.15 is required. “US Person” includes US Citizen, lawful permanent resident, refugee, or asylee.
Basic Qualifications (Required Skills/Experience):
Minimum 10+ years’ experience on data architecture, multi-modal databases and administration activities.
At least 5+ years’ experience with data modeling, data design, customer facing applications support and timely communication with executives.
At least 5+ years’ experience on working with geographical spread teams across time zones.
At least 5+ years Software Development experience in Agile SAFe methodology?
At least 5+ years’ experience on interaction with business architects, data science and business executives.
Preferred Qualifications (Desired Skills/Experience):
Experience in software testing including automated testing is desirable.
Must be flexible, with a high tolerance for organizational complexity and ability to work with partners from within Boeing and outside, across different cultures and time-zones.
Should have excellent interpersonal and communication skills.
Preferred knowledge in Internet-based applications and development like ASP.NET, HTML, JavaScript, jQuery, Bootstrap
Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to thrive in a fast-paced, high pressure environment
Displays excellent oral and written communication skills to team members, peers, customers and management
Strong interpersonal skills - Capable of working as a member of a team, maintaining one's composure in difficult situations.
Collaborate effectively with other team members
Experience in Windows and UNIX operating systems
Ability to take given specifications and generate code for functional applications
Ability to test and debug developed applications
Ability to document all program and application development
Ability to develop good user interfaces
Ability to listen and ask appropriate questions
Typical Education & Experience:
Bachelor's or a Master's degree or 3-year Diploma with typically 10 to 12 year's related work experience or relevant military experience.
Relocation:
This position does not offer relocation. Candidates must live in the immediate area or relocate at their own expense.
Drug Free Workplace:
Boeing is a Drug Free Workplace where post offer applicants and employees are subject to testing for marijuana, cocaine, opioids, amphetamines, PCP, and alcohol when criteria is met as outlined in our policies.
Vaccination Requirements:
Boeing is implementing new requirements for employees to be fully vaccinated from COVID-19 or have an approved reasonable accommodation based on local legislation in several countries including U.S.-based employees. Please refer here for current vaccination and/or reasonable accommodation requirements, and timelines based on location.
Equal Opportunity Employer:
Boeing is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, physical or mental disability, genetic factors, military/veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.

As part of the Cloud Accelerated Systems and Technologies team, you would join a cross-discipline team of highly capable and motivated people in the Azure Hardware Architecture Group. You will collaborate across multiple workstreams and roles like architects, program management leads and engineering leads across the Azure Hardware Architecture Group.
As a member of the design verification team, it is your job to break things. You will work with logic designers to test RTL modules using UVM and will have the opportunity to develop re-usable verification components and testbenches.
If you thrive in a collaborative environment (even while social distancing) and enjoy learning new techniques and approaches for verification and tooling while working on machine learning acceleration hardware for Azure, then this is the position for you.
#azureahajobs
Responsibilities
You will develop testbench components and stimulus using SystemVerilog UVM libraries. On a small, agile team, you will start from microarchitectural specifications and develop test environments and test plans to achieve code coverage targets. You will collaborate via design reviews and code reviews.
Qualifications
Required
Bachelors Degree in Computer Science or equivalent industry experience or equivalent relevant work experience
5+ years experience in UVM or related design verification methodology
Driven to continuously improve and learn
Preferred
7+ years experience in UVM
Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via the Accommodation request form.
Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work.

The Qualtrics XM Platform™ is a system of action that helps businesses to attract customers who stay longer and buy more, to engage and empower employees to do the best work of their lives, to develop breakthrough products people love, and to build a brand people can’t imagine living without.
Joining Qualtrics means becoming part of a team bold enough to chase breakthrough experiences - like building a technology that will be a force for good. A team committed to diversity, equity, and inclusion because of a conviction that every voice holds value, with a vision for representation that matches the world around us and inclusion that far exceeds it. You could belong to a team whose values center on transparency, being all in, having customer obsession, acting as one team, and operating with scrappiness. All so you can do the best work of your career.
We believe every interaction is an opportunity. Are we yours?
Qualtrics Engineering

Our Engineering team is a group of deeply passionate engineers who are breaking new ground in cloud computing and web scalability. We organize and sort terabytes of data and develop solutions used by millions of users every single day. We design products that make sophisticated research simple. Engineering focuses on these tenets; Platform-oriented, API First, Secure, One Product (Our customers shouldn’t have to learn two different ways of solving the same problem), and Quality (Our customers rely on our products to drive their businesses. Our software must work. If a feature is buggy, don’t release it (if it hasn’t been released yet), fix it or take it out.)

IQ R&D

IQ R&D Team works on the cutting edge of technology employing Artificial Intelligence to build highly scalable, accurate models which are consumed by many of our product teams. We seek a creative quality engineer to lead the quality initiatives of this team. The ideal candidate would evaluate and drive the testing approach for machine learning projects, develop automation at scale and collaborate with peer quality engineers, software developers, and research scientists.
Quality Engineering Challenge

Our Quality Engineering organization’s mission is to build a quality culture championing a delightful customer experience while enabling teams to efficiently bring high quality software to all markets. We do this by engaging early to ensure customer use cases are tested AND fully automated. We also automate the release process to save human effort, reduce mistakes, and speed overall delivery. Our environment is primarily Selenium, Protractor, Mocha, Chai, Java, JavaScript, TypeScript, Node.js, Jira, TestRail, Python, Jenkins, Nomad and Docker. In our collaborative culture, you find plenty of opportunities to improve the quality of our software.

Responsibilities
Design test plans and test cases for mobile and web applications
Find, triage, and document bugs worth fixing
Conduct ad-hoc and scripted manual tests
Convert manual test cases into automated cases in an existing framework using Python or JavaScript
Investigate test failures and customer reports using your technical understanding of the product and tools (such as logs) to narrow down repro issues steps and isolate the root problem
Contribute to test frameworks, test tools, and automation for complex, distributed SaaS systems
You ensure the product is tested at the appropriate level (unit vs integration vs end to end, API vs UI), reducing unnecessary test cases, intermittent failures, and decreasing execution time.
Drive quality processes like bug triage, release decisions, and feature completion criteria
You mentor and develop your other team members.
Iteratively test the AI models and verify that the incremental predictions are improving and meeting the benchmarks as set by the Development team.
Communicate with cross functional teams as to how the AI platform is consumed by other downstream teams. Based on this understanding, collaborate with them and make suggestions to their test plans and test strategies.
Requirements
Bachelor's degree in a technical field such as IT, Engineering, Math, Physics or similar with Computer Science coursework or minor. Computer science degree accepted but not required.
2+ years of professional coding experience with any programming language (Prefer experience in Python/JavaScript)
3-6 years of relevant experience as part of a test team
2+ years of experience contributing to test automation and frameworks
Familiar with front-end technologies (including Selenium-based automation), REST web services and/or constructing database queries
An excellent Ad-hoc tester
Experience applying different software testing techniques, such as equivalence class partitioning, boundary value testing, pairwise testing, etc.
Basic understanding of Artificial Intelligence concepts such as deep learning, categorization, classification and data mining.
Machine learning experience is a plus.
What Differentiates Qualtrics from Other Companies
Work–life integration is deeply important to us - we have regular office events, team outings, and happy hours.
We take pride in our offices’ design aiming at cultivating creativity from our rooftop views to an open and collaborative work space.
On top of standard benefits package (medical, dental, vision, life insurance, etc) we provide snacks, drinks, and free lunches in our office.
Qualtrics continues amazing growth; from 2,300 to 8,000 employees by 2023 across the Globe.
Qualtrics Experience Program - $1,800 for an experience of your choosing (eligible after a year)

BS in Computer Science or related field, or equivalent work experience.
1+ year of information security and a desire to learn techniques and technologies such as application security, cryptography, threat modeling, penetration testing, etc.

·

Minimum 2 years of experience with command line utilities and/or scripting on at least one computer operating system, such as Linux/Unix or Windows. BS in IT, CS, or related field, or equivalent work experience

Job summary
Can you adapt to a fast-paced environment supporting projects across all parts of Amazon Web Services rapid evolving businesses? AWS Vendor Security manages risks of all the global external party engagements for AWS. AWS Vendor Security needs Security Engineers who can identity and manage risk. Come join a world-class security organization that is rapidly evolving the cloud services world. AWS Vendor Security is working on cutting edge solutions in partnership with external parties that involve a wide variety of technologies including cloud services, identity and access management, machine learning, mobile devices, and custom hardware — all operating at massive scale.

AWS Security is looking for a Security Engineer to design security controls and help validate that our services, applications, and emerging technologies are designed and implemented to the highest security standards. You will be engaging with teams creating exciting new technologies, requiring highly customized security judgment outside of existing IT and security structures. You will be responsible for analyzing the security of applications and services, discovering and addressing security issues, building security automation, and decisively taking action to remediate emerging threats throughout a full secure development life-cycle (SDLC).

This role will provide career growth opportunities as you gain new security skills in the course of your work. Security engineers at AWS have an opportunity to experiment, learn, build tools, and work with teams building new technology and services at massive scale. Security engineers at all levels have the opportunity to learn from and be mentored by those who are building and securing our cutting-edge services. A security engineer is also expected to be a mentor for others and be a trusted security advisor within the organization.

As a security engineer at Amazon, you are expected to have technical expertise in multiple domains and provide significant contributions to the AWS Security team and to multiple groups throughout Amazon. Security engineers are expected to develop elegant solutions to complex security risk problems and apply appropriate technologies while following security engineering best practices.

As a security engineer at Amazon, you are expected to demonstrate strong Amazon leadership principles. This role requires the ability to foster constructive dialogue and seek resolution when confronted with differing opinions on security risks. Engineers in this role are expected to participate fully in the planning of the AWS Security team's work and constantly seek opportunities for process improvement.

A successful candidate will need a combination of troubleshooting, technical, and communication skills. An AWS Security engineer must have the ability to take ownership and deliver on multiple complex objectives which may include project and software development work.

Your responsibilities will include:

Shaping new services through security review of design, architecture, and implementation
Secure development life-cycle (SDLC) practices including threat modeling and security testing
Strongly influence decision-makers and stakeholders to achieve a consistently high security bar for new services
Scope and assist in penetration testing engagements for services that will operate at cloud-scale
Create security guidance and documentation for team and customers
Develop security tools and automation
Develop and deliver security training and outreach to internal development teams
Lead security projects (including security reviews, tool development, and creation of new security practices) with end-to-end ownership across AWS and Amazon initiatives
Support for mentoring, team building and recruiting activities in a company where security is a critical priority
Opportunities to communicate security findings to senior leadership across the company

About Us
Inclusive Team Culture
Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have ten employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 16 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.

Work/Life Balance
Our team puts a high value on work-life balance. It isn’t about how many hours you spend at home or at work; it’s about the flow you establish that brings energy to both parts of your life. We believe striking the right balance between your personal and professional life is critical to life-long happiness and fulfillment. We offer flexibility in working hours and encourage you to find your own balance between your work and personal lives.

Mentorship & Career Growth

 Nordstrom’s Search team is looking for capable software engineers to build out the next level of our search platform. We provide one of the most important aspects of Nordstrom.com – helping customers find the right products at the right time. We bring together great code, modern tools, and bullet proof engineering practices to make that happen.
As a member of our team, you’ll be working with a cross functional group of top-notch engineers who live and breathe software. We support what we build, so we take quality seriously, and so should you. In this team you will continuously learn and apply the latest technologies, we write great code in whatever language that helps solve our customer problems best.

Seattle, WA

Curi Bio

Apply by clicking the button below or emailing your information to careers@curibio.com.

APPLY NOW
SUMMARY
Curi Bio is a leading developer of human stem cell-based platforms for drug discovery based in Seattle, WA. Curi integrates human stem cell models, tissue specific biosystems, and AI/machine learning-based phenotypic screening into its preclinical discovery platform to accelerate the discovery of the next generation of medicines. With Curi’s suite of human stem cell-based products and services, scientists are able to build more mature and predictive human iPSC-derived tissues, with a focus on cardiac, musculoskeletal, and neuromuscular models. Curi is closing the gap between preclinical data and human results, accelerating the discovery and development of safer, more effective medicines.
Curi is a rapidly growing startup company seeking talented and motivated cardiac iPSC scientist to join our team. As a key member of our team, you would be investigating next-generation bioengineering techniques to improve the translation of new medicines from bench to bedside.
PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES
Lead and contribute to projects involving microscale tissue models, including disease modeling.
Manage junior scientists and research associates in their day-to-day activities for executing research projects.
Perform complex technical work related to stem cell and molecular biology, including stem cell differentiation and advanced cell culture approaches as needed.
Design and oversee a variety of molecular, biochemical, cellular, and/or analytical assays.
Assist cross-functional activities including hand-offs to various teams, compiling data, and presenting.
Communicate and collaborate effectively with scientists and engineers from a variety of disciplines.
Apply project management experience to outline milestones and manage project plans.
Prepare reports and presentations of results in internal and external situations.
Maintain clear communication of timelines, milestones, and project progress to direct and senior management.
Read and disseminate relevant publications/literature to stay updated in the field.
REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS
A Ph.D. in stem cell biology, developmental biology, bioengineering, or a related scientific field, with a strong understanding of cell biology, stem cell biology, physiology, and tissue engineering.
Postdoctoral experience in iPSC cardiomyocyte work.
Strong organizational, time management, and problem-solving skills with scientific attention to detail.
Strong work ethic and adaptability with a passion for working in a fast-paced, dynamic, and diverse work environment.
Experience in performing and optimizing quantitative cell-based assays.
Experience with brightfield and fluorescence microscopy.
Ability to write and follow established standard operating procedures.
Ability to work effectively both independently and in collaboration with other teams.
Excellent written, verbal, and interpersonal communication skills.
Able to use or learn to work in a digital environment, including electronic lab notebooks, cloud-based data analysis, use of instrumentation software, and project management tools.
Highly adaptable and responsive, and committed to completing tasks in a timely fashion.
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Experience in complex mammalian tissue culture such as multi-cell type co-culture, 3D cell culture/organoid biology, or stem cell culture.
Experience with culture and handling of induced pluripotent stem cells.
Experience with in vitro drug testing and analysis.
Post-doctoral training in a field related to in vitro assay development is a plus but not required.
WORK ENVIRONMENT
The job responsibilities of this position are predominantly performed on-site at Curi Bio HQ near downtown Seattle.
Will enter a BSL2 laboratory environment, including potential exposure to biohazards.
Some weekend/evening work may be required as needed.
Occasional lifting up to 30 pounds.
Fine motor movements in fingers/hands to operate computers and lab equipment.
Must be able to follow all COVID-19 risk reduction and risk mitigation guidelines as provided by federal, state, and local governments, building management, and the company.

Role Purpose:
At Jumio, you will work for the market leader in online identity verification that is helping to make the digital world a safer place for everyone. As a Senior Product Manager, you will own the roadmap for Jumio’s user onboarding platform. You will closely work with the customers, partners, business development, legal and engineering teams to identify the risk and fraud capabilities on the platform to enable end to end orchestration of our customer’s end user journey and help expand the state of the art in this exciting domain.
Role Value:
The KYX Platform Senior PM is responsible for building an essential component of a unified platform that adapts to the unique needs and risks of organizations. The Jumio KYX Platform lets modern enterprises easily verify user identities for onboarding, safeguard existing accounts and mitigate financial crime risk. You’ll own an important strategic piece of the Jumio KYX Platform strategy.
Responsibilities:
Engage with internal and external stakeholders to define product roadmap and functional requirements
Provide vision and direction to the cross-functional development team and stakeholders
Closely collaborate with engineering and product design teams to integrate new risk, fraud and AML checks
Create and maintain a product backlog according to business case and company strategy
Translate business requirements and product initiatives into epics and user stories.
Ensure that agile teams have a clear understanding of what they are developing and why (business case)
Monitor product development progress on an ongoing basis
Work closely with the user experience team to deliver world class experience to Jumio customers
Closely follow the industry trends and best practices to refine product direction as necessary
Effectively communicate product updates with the stakeholders all over the globe
Experience and Qualifications:
8+ years professional experience that includes 2 or more years as a Product Manager/Product Owner in an agile environment
Solid understanding of the risk, fraud and AML checks for the user onboarding use cases
High level understanding of machine learning concepts
Knowledge of agile processes and principles
Great attention to detail
Exceptional analytical, conceptual and spoken/written communication skills
Ability to travel domestically and internationally for business
Great to have Experience and Qualifications:
Expertise in KYC/AML, Identity Verification and Fraud Prevention
Prior experience with established vendors in the above domains
Example Objectives:
Contribution in creating requirements documents for new products / features
Take responsibility for the organizational rollout of a new feature or product by working closely with Sales, Marketing and Support to create the necessary internal and external training material
Key Characteristics and Attitudes:
In a recent global survey these attributes were valued by Jumios in all locations and functions - we firmly believe in hiring for attitude as well as skill.
Friendly and supportive
Adaptable and flexible
Articulate and persuasive
High IQ and EQ
Curious and coachable
Commercially Aware
Resilient and tenacious
Big picture and the detail
Jumio Values:
IDEAL: Integrity, Diversity, Empowerment, Accountability, Leading Innovation
Company:
Jumio is the future for online and mobile ID verification. We are the largest and fastest growing company in the ID verification space. With a global footprint, we’re expanding the team to meet strong client demand across a range of industries including Financial Services, Travel, Sharing Economy, Fintech, Gaming, and others.
Equal Opportunities:
Jumio is a collaboration of people with different ideas, strengths, interests and cultures. We welcome applications and colleagues from all backgrounds and statuses.

JobTitle: Sr. Product Manager-Tech, Delivery Quality, Driver Experienc...
Content_text:
Bachelor's Degree
5+ years of experience in product or program management, product marketing, business development or technology
Experience with end to end product delivery
Experience overseeing roadmap strategy and definition
Experience with feature delivery and tradeoffs of a product
Experience contributing to engineering discussions around technology decisions and strategy related to a product

Job summary

Our team:
At Amazon, we're working to be the most customer-centric company on earth. We are constantly looking to exceed the expectations of our customers by ensuring that their orders, no matter how large or small, are delivered where and when they need them, as quickly, accurately, and cost effectively as possible. To meet this goal, Amazon is investing heavily to innovate and provide best in class services in the Last Mile delivery space. In the Last Mile Driver Experience team, we own the driver experience for delivering all Amazon packages, groceries, ultra fast Prime Now deliveries, and more, world wide. The Last Mile Driver Experience is powered by a mobile app, available on both iOS and Android, and works in concert with our logistics and technology to guide drivers through the delivery journey. In 2020 our apps powered 8 billion package deliveries and in 2021 we crossed our 10 billion packages delivered milestone.

The role:
This role owns Delivery Quality, the last step of the delivery journey and closest to the customer. Our mission is to ensure every package is delivered at the right time, at the right location, in the right way, and in accordance with the customer's preferences. Our drivers deliver in many settings, ranging from single-family home, apartment units behind a locked gate, college campus, to countryside residences worldwide. This role sets drivers up for success by giving drivers guidance and guardrails, and helps Amazon achieve promise to the customers. We leverage machine learning to use data from past deliveries to help us get smarter for future deliveries.

This role is inherently cross-functional—this leader will work closely with engineering, program management, design, operations, finance, legal, business development, customer service, and executive teams to bring products to market, develop and grow business opportunities, and enhance our existing products and features. A successful candidate will be highly analytical, resourceful, customer-focused, and team oriented. The leader will have a proven track record in taking on end-to-end ownership and successfully delivering results in a dynamic business environment. Come join the team and help us make history!

This role has flexibility for Austin, TX, Bellevue, WA, and Toronto, ON, Canada.


MBA
Strong oral and written communication skills, as well as ability to think clearly, analyze quantitatively, problem-solve, support scope of requirements and prioritize
Sound business judgment, proven ability to influence others, and strong analytical thinking skills are critical to success in this position
Proven track record of delivering projects within scope, time, budget and quality
An entrepreneurial mindset, with the tenacity to develop ideas independently and thrive in fast-paced environment is crucial
Exceptional passion for delivering world-class customer experiences.
Experience in the product development of mobile applications.
Demonstrated ability to understand and discuss technical concepts, manage tradeoffs and evaluate opportunistic new ideas with internal and external partners.
Demonstrated ability to turn customer needs and pain points into innovative products.
Strengths in problem solving, issue-resolution, ability to work in a deadline-driven work environment, attention to detail, and ability to multitask.
Strong verbal and written communication skills with a demonstrated experience engaging and influencing senior executives.
Proven ability to work independently to drive projects to completion.
Experience in supply chain, operations, logistics, or transportation.

JobTitle: Senior/Lead Full Stack Software Engineer, Machine Learning -...
Content_text:
To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.
Job Category
Products and Technology
Job Details
Tableau has become the world's leading analytics platform by helping people see and understand their data. Increasingly, to understand their data, organizations are looking to develop and deploy predictive models to drive better and faster decisions. But ML is only useful when teams can answer the right questions, with clean reliable data, and deliver predictions seamlessly into business workflows. Tableau’s approach to this problem is called Business Science, and our goal is to help more people and organizations succeed with ML through intuitive and powerful modeling experiences that emphasize collaboration and models that are built close to where the business needs them.


In the Business Science team, we are building a new experience to bring enterprise scale machine learning modeling techniques into the hands of the data domain experts. This will allow rich collaboration across organizations, letting people with different expertise and backgrounds have a voice in the process, and allowing for model explanation and evaluation. Our team handles tough back-end challenges, but also has a strong focus on creating a delightful UI for our customers.



In this role you will:
Design and implement cross-platform products and features
Make technical decisions for key features on the team’s roadmap
Provide technical guidance and support to a vibrant engineering team
Innovate Tableau code base and technologies
Improve and instill engineering practices
Drive collaboration with partner teams across Tableau Development organization
Work in a fast paced, agile environment
Master the products and learning how our customers use Tableau and Salesforce

Who you are:

Experienced . You have extensive experience developing exceptional quality and easy to use commercial software. You have significant experience working with full-stack web architecture. You know how to make UI that feels effortless to the user. Familiarity with Data Science and Machine Learning is a plus.
Educated . You have a solid foundation of computer science and software development fundamentals established through learning and experience.
Technical. You are skilled with Java and C++, comfortable with working in complex, multithreaded code and understand API design concepts. You have strong front-end fundamentals, with experience using JavaScript or TypeScript. Familiarity with microservices is a plus. Familiarity with both Linux and Windows is a plus.
Technical Leader . You lead by example a group of distributed engineers driving features from ideation through development to monitoring and maintenance after release. You enjoy collaborating, learning from experts, and consistently providing technical guidance to team members.
Maintain High Standards . You love building great products. You are passionate about maintaining high code quality. You hold the team to a high standard through code reviews. You believe in writing tests for your own code. You are able to identify areas for improvement and work on bringing about positive change over time.
Strong Communicator . You distill complex technical information down to the key elements and communicate both design ideas and technical details effectively. You understand your audience and adapt your presentation to the right level of detail.
Customer-focused . You have a habit of thinking from a customer’s perspective. The overall user experience of a product is important to you. You are eager to help identify and solve potential problems our customers might encounter in the field.
Recruiter! Tableau hires company builders, and in this role, you will be asked to be on the lookout for the best talent to bring onboard to help us continue to build one of the best companies in the world!
Accommodations
If you require assistance due to a disability applying for open positions please submit a request via this Accommodations Request Form .
Posting Statement
At Salesforce we believe that the business of business is to improve the state of our world. Each of us has a responsibility to drive Equality in our communities and workplaces. We are committed to creating a workforce that reflects society through inclusive programs and initiatives such as equal pay, employee resource groups, inclusive benefits, and more. Learn more about Equality at Salesforce and explore our benefits.
Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org are Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employers. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org do not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org will not pay any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with Salesforce.com or Salesforce.org .
Salesforce welcomes all.

5+ years of business development, product management, management consulting, strategic partnerships, or enterprise sales experience.
Experience developing and executing on GTM strategies that are large in scope.
Working knowledge of one or more ML Frameworks (e.g., PyTorch, TensorFlow) and ML methods including NLP models (BERT, GPT-2/3), computer vision-based models (object detection, image recognition), and text-based models (Seq2Seq, Topic modeling).
Experience interfacing with customers (Enterprise, SMB, and Startups) and ability to convert customer requirements to high level architecture solutions to build on.
Strong analytical skills, and demonstrated ability to turn detailed data analysis into useful strategic insight that drives customer adoption and recommendations to the business.
Strong verbal and written communications skills are a must. Experience speaking at technology conferences, as well as communicating across the organization from technical staff to VP/CxOs.
Demonstrated ability to work effectively across internal and external organizations is key in a matrix environment.
Business and/or technical degree required

Are you passionate about developing impactful Machine Learning (ML), novel and rigorous engineering strategy? Are you passionate about engaging the AI/ML community (AI researchers, developers, data scientists, data engineers, and innovative entrepreneurs in hot startups and large enterprises)?

Artificial Intelligence (AI) has the potential to transform our society and community for generations. Impacting transportation, mobility, telecommunication, energy, healthcare and insurance, hospitality, assistance to the elderly and disabled. Achieving this requires implementing complex computing systems that we entrust with assisting humans. AWS is taking a fresh approach in providing an end-to-end, scalable cloud environment that simplifies the development and deployment of AI/ML technology. Including a global cloud footprint, infinitely scalable cloud storage, advanced networking and security, state-of-the-art AI platforms and services, rigorous engineering, and a team with the longest experience building cloud technologies.
We are looking for an experienced and motivated candidate for the role of Senior Business Development for AI/ML Frameworks. In this role, you will be responsible for defining, building, and deploying targeted strategies to accelerate customer adoption of key ML Frameworks and the AWS ML solution stack. In this role, you will work closely with customers to understand the infrastructural requirements, complexities involved in scaling ML applications across use-cases like natural language processing (NLP) and computer vision that take advantage of the power of AWS’ storage, compute, networking, and ML technologies.
You will have the opportunity to define go-to-market (GTM) strategies and lead cross-functional initiatives to expand existing markets, develop scalable programs to drive adoption, and identify new opportunities. This involves activities include market sizing, building an opportunity pipeline, working with customers to understand technical requirements for proof-of-concepts, creating content to train the field teams, driving industry thought-leadership, working with product teams to define new features, and identifying partners and potential acquisitions.
As the ideal candidate, you possess a business and technology background that enables you to lead and drive engagements with startups and large enterprises. You have domain expertise in key ML use cases (e.g., NLP, computer vision), understand the challenges involved in training and deploying models, MLOps, orchestrating workloads using containers, and are able to work backwards from customer requirements to suggest scalable solutions and architectures. You have the technical depth to articulate the benefits of ML Frameworks and AWS services to data scientists, data engineers, and C-Level executives. In addition, you have a good understanding of the AI/ML market trends, ecosystem, opportunities, and are passionate about market development and evangelism of ML Frameworks and AWS ML solutions. You will need to be adept at interacting, communicating, and partnering with teams within AWS (product, solutions architecture, sales, marketing, and professional services) and externally with customers, partners, and importantly, the developer community of ML Frameworks and key open-source offerings.

You will be responsible for creating compelling content, and building scalable programs and mechanisms to increase awareness and adoption of ML Frameworks and AWS solutions. Additionally, you will work with the AWS ML and EC2 product teams to shape product vision and prioritize features for AI/ML Frameworks and applications. A keen sense of ownership, drive, and being scrappy is a must.

About AWS

Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the pioneer and recognized leader in Cloud Computing. Our web services provide a platform for IT infrastructure in-the-cloud that is used by hundreds of thousands of developers and businesses around the world. These customers range from start-ups to leading web companies to Global 2000 companies in financial services, pharmaceuticals, and technology. AWS customers are looking for ways to transform their businesses and solve their own complex business challenges with ML technologies in the cloud. AWS is leading the way in providing customers with powerful, end-to-end ML platforms such as Amazon SageMaker.

Roles & Responsibilities:

Develop and execute go-to-market strategies focusing on AI/ML Frameworks and AWS ML solutions and technologies to target key workloads like NLP and computer vision.
Lead senior level customer meetings to discuss business and technical challenges and explore how AWS can help address them.
Define, build, and launch startups and enterprise focused campaigns around deploying successful ML architectures on AWS.
Collaborate effectively with ML solution architects and experts to develop scalable architectures and end-end solutions to solve key customer challenges.
Serve as an evangelist for AI/ML Frameworks (e.g., PyTorch on AWS), engage closely with customers, the developer community, and key partners.
Develop market intelligence frameworks to identify market trends, use cases, choice of tools and architectures, and partners.
Develop content (e.g., blogs, whitepapers, case studies), lead workshops / hackathons, and represent AWS at key AI/ML conferences.
Train and enable the AWS field teams on the value propositions of key ML Frameworks and AWS solutions and technologies. This would include developing sales plays, targeted campaigns, an enabling the field to uncover and drive ML opportunities.

Inclusive Team Culture
Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have twelve employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 14 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.

Work/Life Balance
Our team puts a high value on work-life balance. It isn’t about how many hours you spend at home or at work; it’s about the flow you establish that brings energy to both parts of your life. We believe striking the right balance between your personal and professional life is critical to life-long happiness and fulfillment. We offer flexibility in working hours and encourage you to find your own balance between your work and personal lives.

Mentorship & Career Growth
Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. Our senior members enjoy one-on-one mentoring and thorough, but kind, code reviews. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded engineer and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.


MBA or equivalent relevant business experience.
Deep hands-on working knowledge of deep learning and other ML algorithms and infrastructure.
Experience developing, deploying and managing AI products at scale.
Experience writing technical articles, speaking at technology conferences, and contributing to open source.
Experience managing and deploying ML products.

JobTitle: Sr. Manager, Product Management - Finance Science
Content_text:
Bachelor's degree in finance, tech, accounting, business or related field
8+ years of relevant product and/or finance experience
8+ years of Excel and SQL experience and analytical skill

Are you seeking an environment where you can drive innovation? Amazon is seeking a Product leader to help design and lead a new team in WW Consumer Finance Science and Analytics. Our team is responsible for generating descriptive, predictive and prescriptive analytics, finance transformation and application of machine learning and quantitative methods into finance.

This role will act as a primary leader in our vision to evolve corporate finance into a quantitative and technical powerhouse. The successful candidate will lead a small product team responsible for data science and economic injection across forecasting, nowcasting, causal inference, anomaly detection, external (macro) drivers, and ad hoc ML applications. This includes inheriting attribution and driver products, identifying several opportunities, and launching new products.

The successful candidate will act both strategically and tactically, from the high level vision to the detail necessary to create a bar-raising product. You will collaborate with other process and tech program/program managers, identifying and providing the science vision access Retail, Third Part Seller, Supply Chain and Stores. You will also work with finance leaders to identify user stories and own the science forecasting PR/FAQ, UI, UX, and customer driven features. You will partner with peer teams in data engineering, science, economics and software development on production and implementation. You will also develop key business metrics / KPIs, and be able to provide clear, compelling analysis that shapes Amazon.

This position is open in either Seattle, WA or Santa Monica, CA.


Understanding of technology platforms, interactions and system design
Ability to understand and manage iterations between non-technical and technical professionals
Proven ability to collaborate, provide opinions, and reach across the aisle for compromise
Experience with accounting and financial reporting systems
Experience working on problems of a financial nature
Experience working on financial forecasts or managing a P&L
Understanding of science or technical application for problem transformation
Deep understanding of supply chains, cost drivers, topline drivers

SITE RELIABILITY ENGINEER MANAGER
You continuously improve Symbl’s ability to provide products to customers while simultaneously delivering industry-leading availability. You are a tenacious technological leader who develops junior engineers while constantly pushing the boundaries of what’s possible.
Who you are
Initiative - you take complete ownership of your tasks and champion efforts to get them to completion.
Collaborative - your refined communication skills allow you to ensure alignment within and across teams.
Quality - your obsession with solving problems quickly never sacrifices quality or future scalability.

ABOUT SYMBL.AI
What we do
We enable builders to quickly and easily deploy Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning.
Conversation Intelligence (Conversation AI) enables computers to understand, process, and respond to natural, everyday human conversations. We provide deep tech AI/ML developer tools. Our proprietary patented contextual understanding engine powers real-time and post communication innovations in developer products.
We move fast, stay aligned, and prioritize connection and growth.
Why you want to meet us
We are solving the hardest problems of human conversation by building novel and deep tech AI/ML.
You will have the agency to solve difficult problems creatively, the freedom to explore work that inspires you, and the infrastructure to ensure you’re constantly developing.
Our culture creates a high-energy and supportive environment with a multitude of growth opportunities, the chance to make your mark, and a team of exceptional colleagues.
Who we are
We are a fast-growing, early-stage venture-backed startup.
We are an internationally distributed, multicultural team of smart, humble, and driven innovators who are constantly leveling up personally and professionally.
We are alumni of Agora, AWS, Goldman Sachs, Postman, Techstars,and Twillio.
We are curious, tenacious, and resilient. We champion diversity and strive to create conditions that provide everyone with the opportunity to thrive.
Location and hours
We are a distributed team with centers of gravity in Seattle, Washington and Pune, India. Our intentions for a post-pandemic world are to operate on a flexible hybrid model.
Considering the ‘current normal’/ uncertain times we are in there is geographical flexibility with the understanding that you will relocate to the Seattle area when it makes sense.
We embrace work-life integration aiming to unify our work, responsibilities, relationships, and leisures into meaningful and well-lived days. Our culture is one of self-accountability. You are trusted to determine how and when you do your best work.
You will work on a team with passionate individuals from around the globe. Collaboration at Symbl regularly requires a flexible schedule.
Start Date
Flexible for the right candidate

Healthcare
Unlimited PTO
Paid sick days
Paid holidays
Continuing education
Equity and performance-based pay options
As our company evolves, so do our benefits. We’re actively innovating how we support our employees.

Innovate. Collaborate. Build. Create. Solve. The KPMG Digital Lighthouse is KPMG's award-winning Analytics & AI Center of Excellence recognized by clients and leading analyst firms in the US and globally. The KPMG Lighthouse is a curation of specialized technical capabilities and domain experts working across the digital landscape: applied data science, AI, data engineering and insights, software engineering, automation, and big data. Here, you'll work with a diverse team of professionals to explore and build solutions for clients in a multiplatform environment.
You'll be an important part of our high-energy, unique, fast-paced, and innovative culture that delivers with the agility of a tech startup and the backing of a leading global consulting firm. In this particular role, you'll work specifically in the AI Analytics & Engineering Community within the Digital Lighthouse, on a wide range of projects. From applied AI to optimization to big data platform engineering, your analytical and technical skills will drive real impact in the business world. At KPMG, our commitment to your career development helps to set us apart as an employer. We want to enhance your potential, both for yourself and as a contributor to our firm. That's why we provide every opportunity to expand your skills, knowledge and experiences through formal education and training programs, leadership development opportunities, and, as well as informal one-on-one coaching and mentoring from your KPMG colleagues.
KPMG is currently seeking an Associate, Simulation & Optimization Data Scientist to join our KPMG Lighthouse - Center of Excellence for Advanced Analytics.
Responsibilities:
Apply various optimization techniques to generate solutions to large-scale optimization problems for KPMG clients, such as resource planning, scheduling, facility location, portfolio optimization, and pricing/revenue optimization. Techniques include but are not limited to linear programming/mixed-integer programming with commercial (e.g. CPLEX, Gurobi) as well as open-source solvers (e.g. GLPK, CBC), dynamic programming, heuristics, metaheuristics, and more.
Develop and employ simulation models (Discrete Event, Agent-Based, and System Dynamics modeling) by using simulation software AnyLogic (Preferred), NetLogo, Simulink and/or ARENA
Process structured, unstructured and semi-structured data and apply data cleaning, data imputation and feature engineering methods prior to developing models
Develop predictive models using Machine Learning (e.g. classification, clustering, regression, dimensionality reduction methods), Natural Language Processing (OCR, information extraction), and statistical analysis methods such as time-series analysis, statistical inference, and validation tools; perform exploratory data analyses, generate and test working hypotheses, prepare and analyze historical data, and identify patterns
Work directly with KPMG clients and stakeholders to present and explain the key techniques and major results generated using non-technical language; understand client feedback and be able to accommodate it into model through programming
Come up with innovative, repeatable, business use cases for real world optimization techniques, and quickly develop prototypes to test these use cases
Utilize a diverse array of technologies and tools as needed, to deliver insights, such as Python, R, Julia, C++, Tableau, and more

Qualifications:
Bachelors Degree in Operations Research, Computer Science, Applied Mathematics, Industrial Engineering, or related field from an accredited college or university with 1+ years of professional services experience
Professional knowledge of advanced analytical concepts, particularly ModSim (Modeling & Simulation), Optimization and Machine Learning;
Experience utilizing a strong mathematical background with advanced knowledge in one or more of the following fields: discrete optimization, integer programming (including commercial optimization solvers), discrete-event simulation, dynamic programming, local search heuristics, genetic algorithms, or other metaheuristics
Proficiency in programming languages (e.g. Python, R, C++, Julia), data analysis packages (e.g.scikit-learn, pyomo) as well as the ability to implement, maintain, debug and test; experience in commercial optimization solvers (e.g. CPLEX, Gurobi, Xpress)
Experience in software development using version control (Git), unit testing, Jira, and Confluence.
Ability to work with team members and clients to assess needs, provide assistance, and resolve problems, using excellent problem-solving skills, verbal/written communication, and the ability to present and explain technical concepts to business audiences
Professional experience with high proficiency in the use of Microsoft Office programs (Word, PowerPoint, Excel)
Active DoD Secret or DoD Top Secret (TS) clearance nice to have
Ability to travel when necessary; Applicants must be currently authorized to work in the United States without the need for visa sponsorship now or in the future
