Position: Senior Machine Learning Scientist
Experience: 2+ Years
Location: Seattle or San Francisco
Education: Preferred: MS/PhD in a STEM or statistical subject.
Interested in joining a highly technical, passionate, and close-knit team of data scientists and machine learning engineers working on state-of-the-art algorithms and technologies? In prototyping, live-testing, and helping productionize deep learning, online and reinforcement learning, natural language processing (NLP), and more? In working on high impact problems with enormous data sets while in an agile, friendly, small company environment? The Science team at Algonomy may be the ideal next step in your career.
You will be:
Identifying and solving machine learning problems involving Bayesian optimization, neural networks, NLP, computer vision, and more
Productionizing solutions at scale
Committing and reviewing code in Python, Tensorflow, and Java
Working with experimental and live data
Communicating and collaborating with engineering, product management, and client support teams

Requirements:
(NB: years of experience specified below may be concurrent)
2+ years professional experience implementing machine learning algorithms
2+ years professional experience writing production-quality code
Familiarity with probability, statistics, linear algebra
12+ months intensive experience with at least one of the following:
 Bayesian optimization, Bandits, or Reinforcement Learning
Deep Learning, NLP, or computer vision
Experience with databases, distributed data, and data wrangling
Excellent communication, collaboration, and teamwork skills

About Algonomy
At Algonomy, we believe the future of our economy is Algorithmic, where businesses will develop resilient, adaptive and agile decisioning abilities that will constantly test and refine AI-driven actions to create the best personal experience for every individual customer at scale.
We aim to become the algorithmic bridge between consumers and brands/retailers, and to lead our customers through the Algorithmic transformation imperative. The name Algo-nomy signifies an expertise in algorithms. As technology evolves our lives (and our clients’) at hyper-speed, Algonomy stands as a bold, creative and agile brand; and these are also the very qualities that every digital-first business needs in order to be successful in the new normal. We are ambitious, we create category leading solutions in our markets, and we are constantly learning, inventing and adapting to stay ahead of our industry’s needs.

Facebook designs, builds and operates one of the largest globally-distributed CDNs in the world. As an Optimization Engineer for Facebook's Edge Network, you will have a unique opportunity to use your broad engineering skills to partner with product engineering teams to improve user experience for billions of people across Facebook, Instagram, WhatsApp, Messenger, Oculus, and many more products. You will build scalable systems that provide critical product performance insights, simulate end-to-end impact of massive scale events, and drive caching architecture decisions.


Work cross-functionally with highly technical software engineering and network engineering teams.
Build systems and tools, develop capacity planning frameworks, and root-cause the hardest problems on some of the largest and most complex systems in the world.
Build stochastic models to characterize demand at every layer of the CDN and write software to generate capacity plans optimized for reliability, performance, and cost constraints.
Leverage machine learning and related techniques to deliver solutions for large network infrastructure problems.
Build and maintain complex optimization models.
Leverage data you produce to improve platform architecture and design.


BS/BA degree in an analytical field (e.g. Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, Operations Research, Physics, or Management Science).
2+ years of coding experience in at least one programming language (e.g. PHP, Python, C++, or Java), and rapidly learning new development languages.
Knowledge of network infrastructure and/or routing.
Experience with data logging and processing at scale.
Experience with analysis of network and performance metrics.
Hands-on experience with large quantities of data.
Experience partnering with highly technical engineering teams to solve open ended issues.


Graduate work experience.


Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to share what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Together, we can help people build stronger communities - we're just getting started.


Facebook is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law.Facebook is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for candidates with disabilities in our recruiting process. If you need any assistance or accommodations due to a disability, please let us know at accommodations-ext@fb.com.

Do you want to help connect people all over the world, and work on a team building the next generation of planet scale AR games? We're looking for hardworking people to help our company become more data focused; folks with the ability to be dedicated, thorough, and independent while working in a dynamic, fast-paced environment.

Responsibilities
Translate quantitative findings in concise and clear messages to leadership and external partners.
Embedded within a product - you are the data guru responsible for setting and monitoring targets, diagnosing problems, quantifying impact, and coming up with solutions.
Have a "product first" mindset that aligns with our mission, values and strategy.
Drive consensus; independently deliver data insights that drive cross-functional decisions across multiple teams.
Be a hands-on self-starter and stay on top of data science methodologies.
Qualifications
Extensive experience with SQL and data ETL systems; deep knowledge using Python or R.
Deep understanding of statistics, live product analytics, and modeling techniques.
Knowledge and experience with A/B testing or randomized control trials.
BA/BS in statistics, applied mathematics, computer science, machine learning, economics or a related field.
Graduate degree in relevant fields preferred but not required.
2+ years work experience in data science or analytics role.
Join the Niantic team!

Niantic is the world's leading AR technology company, sparking creative and engaging journeys in the real world. Our products inspire outdoor exploration, exercise, and meaningful social interaction.

Originally formed at Google in 2011, we became an independent company in 2015 with a strong group of investors including Nintendo, The Pokémon Company, and Alsop Louie Partners. Our current consumer titles include pioneering global-control game Ingress, record-breaking AR game Pokémon GO, and Pikmin Bloom. In November 2021, we launched our developer platform, Lightship, enabling creators to build immersive AR experiences around the globe.

Niantic is an Equal Opportunity employer. We believe that cultivating a workplace where our people are supported and included is essential to creating great products our community will love. Our mission emphasizes seeking and hiring diverse voices, including those who are traditionally underrepresented in the technology industry, and we consider this to be one of the most important values we hold close.

We're a hard-working, fun, and exciting group who value intellectual curiosity and a passion for problem-solving! We have growing offices located in San Francisco, Sunnyvale, Bellevue, Los Angeles, New York, London, Tokyo, Hamburg, and Zurich.

JobTitle: Senior Software Engineer, Smart Home Machine Learning, Feedb...
Content_text:
2+ years of experience contributing to the architecture and design (architecture, design patterns, reliability and scaling) of new and current systems
3+ years of programming experience with at least one modern language such as Java, C++, or C# including object-oriented design
4+ years of professional software development experience
2+ years of experience as a mentor, tech lead OR leading an engineering team

Job summary
The Smart Home team is focused on making Alexa the user interface for the home. From the simplest voice commands (turn on the lights, turn down the heat) to use cases spanning home security, home entertainment, and the home environment, we are evolving Alexa into intelligent, indispensable companion that automates daily control and simplifies interaction with appliances and electronics.

Key job responsibilities
You'll work with ML scientists to build scalable infrastructure that vends predictions about how customers use and interact with smart devices in their homes. These services enable Alexa to proactively take action on behalf of the customer rather than writing for specific instructions. Our team focuses on collecting and leveraging customer feedback from several services in real time to make our proactive control adaptive and to personalize predictive experiences for customers. We are a product focused team-- our greatest satisfaction comes from building meaningful products for our large customer base. This is an opportunity to have an impact on the way people live.

A day in the life
Lead the work to define, scope, and plan the engineering workstreams on the team.

Meet frequently with ML scientists who are building models for Smart Home. Help identify where tradeoffs in modeling structure could make big differences in scope or efficiency of inference.

Meet regularly with scientists, engineers, and product managers from other teams to brainstorm new ideas, identify opportunities for collaboration, and clarify ambiguous problems. This could result in writing project proposals with our collaborators and designing components that have cross-team components.

Write clear emails and design documents that convey your work to an audience with varying levels of Software and ML knowledge.

Mentor junior engineers through code reviews, design reviews, and tradeoff discussions. Provide valuable feedback.

Actively participate in interviewing for Amazon software engineers.

About the team
The Feedback and Relevance Team is made up of Applied Scientists, Data Scientists, and Machine Learning Engineers.

We are part of a larger Smart Home Machine Learning organization and collaborate with other teams in this org to deliver large scale ML-based features.

We are interdisciplinary and we act like it-- we ask each other questions and value our different perspectives.


Interest or experience in machine learning
Good written and oral communication skills
